At least one F2P game shipped as a Game Designer or similar role. High proficiency with Excel, Google Apps, Confluence, and JIRA. Avid gamer with a strong understanding for free to play design, mechanics, and strategies. Ability to reference mechanics, controls, and other elements from other F2P games. Proven record of creative problem solving; knows how to take a concept from other games and translate it into a solution for your project. Must be data literate and understand how KPIs translate into design solutions. Strong knowledge of retention, engagement, monetization, and how to design for different player segments. Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to pitch complex ideas to a non-design audience and get buy-in. Takes accountability and ownership of designs from start to finish. Problem solver, results-oriented, self-motivated and disciplined. Able to multi-task like a pro. (259, ' 258 --> Solution Architect - DaaS & Managed Services Lenovo Greenock, Scotland, United Kingdom Description And Requirements Lenovo is seeking an experienced Device as a Service (DaaS) Solution Architect who will develop comprehensive, creative, and cost-effective services solutions for our customers within a Device as a Service model. These bricks allow the simulation of robots, complex machines, digital dummies, and are used for the purposes of designing workstations, virtual reality training and job evaluation. The XDE physics engine is based on a client-server architecture allowing it to communicate with external processes, such as robot controllers, automatons or motion capture devices. XDE is also exhibited in the Unity3D platform for setting up complex demonstrators in virtual reality and mixed reality. In recent years, collaborative simulations in virtual reality have become more and more common, with multiple players and the development of new technologies around the metaverse and avatars. In particular, Nvidias Omniverse platform is increasingly put forward to advocate the interoperability of different applications and the development of the metaverse. The purpose of the internship will initially be to learn about and evaluate Nvidias Omniverse platform. The internship will then have to use and evaluate the Unity 3D connector for Omniverse. Finally, the internship will have to evaluate the possibility of integrating the XDE engine within the Omniverse platform and propose a first implementation prototype. The internship includes a bibliography phase, a phase of getting to grips with the laboratory tools, an evaluation phase and a prototype implementation phase. (272, ' 271 --> Cloud Developer Atlas Copco Antwerp, Flemish Region, Belgium (On-site) The Role Do you like to program cloud native applications? Atlas Copco CT is a worldwide producer of compressed air solutions: compressors, dryers, gas generators, …. A lot of these machines are today connected such that we receive a continuous stream of data about their running parameters and conditions. Based on engineering knowledge and data analysis we are creating models to mimics the machines and determine which components need maintenance and when. To operationalize these models, we are investing in a cloud native architecture. We need your help to write the services to run in this environment. Do you like to collaborate with data scientists and engineers? At Atlas Copco engineers and data scientist work together to build mathematical and statistical models to simulate how machines work and components degrade. These “digital twins” help us to improve machine design and maintenance. After creation, these models need to be deployed on large scale with high reliability. Within the cloud native development team your focus will be on developing, deploying and maintain programs to execute predictive maintenance. Do you want to grow with us in the exciting new world of the industrial metaverse? Together we will be building up our infrastructure and deepen our competences to explore new possibilities. If you like to work in a modern cloud set-up within an international context as well as enjoy being part of a small, enthusiastic team, we encourage you to apply. What we expect of you? Working with our executive team, marketing, product and services team, we drive the adoption of Infura in many core market segments (Defi / DAOs / Wallets, NFTs / Metaverse / Gaming, and Enterprise, financial services and Web2 companies) as well as through strategic partners, incubators, VCs, ISVs and system integrators. What You Do As a Pre-Sales Architect (Infura, Developers Tools & Infrastructure), you support product sale efforts by advising customers on ways to integrate Infura and other developer products with their tech stack. While the role is not a sales quota-carrying role currently, the acquisition and retention of Infura customers are some of its main OKRs (objectives & key results). Day-to-day, you participate in discovery and sales calls with Web3 companies, blockchain application builders, DeFi protocols and NFT platforms in order to articulate the benefits of the Infura product suite and identify ways to integrate these products into the customers workflows. Once a customer need has been identified, you drive the technical sales cycle with a high degree of autonomy, organizing technical workshops with customer stakeholders, delivering technical architectures and diagrams, demos, estimating the time and cost of integration steps, working with professional services and partners as needed, and delivering customer-ready technical proposals summarizing your findings and recommendations. You work closely with the Infura product team in order to understand how the current features and API endpoints, and product roadmap, may be relevant to the customer’s needs and drive feature requirements feedback. You continuously learn about Ethereum technology, DeFi protocols, NFT innovations, DAOs and Wallets and ConsenSys product features, in order to be regarded as a world-class expert on decentralized application infrastructure on public blockchain networks. The role is global in scope (Americas, EMEA, APAC). It mostly involves remote work, but occasional travel up to 30% of the time to attend customer meetings, conferences or hackathons may be involved. Excellent customer-facing and communication skills (demos, workshops, public speaking, discussions with C-level and with developers) Experienced in gathering, understanding and rationalizing customer business requirements. Strong emotional intelligence and ability to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders on multiple opportunities in a fast pace environment Should be comfortable working as an independent contributor and as part of a team Solutions Architect certification with any one of the cloud providers (AWS, Azure or Google) is a nice to have Dont meet all the requirements? Dont sweat it. We’re passionate about building a diverse team of humans and as such, if you think youve got what it takes for our chaotic-but-fun, remote-friendly, start-up environment—apply anyway, detailing your relevant transferable skills in your cover letter. While we have a pretty good idea of what we need, were ready for you to challenge our thinking on who needs to be in this role. ConsenSys is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. We are committed to ensuring that our technology is made available and accessible to everyone. What Youll Work On Ongoing marketing strategy support for 10-15 hours over the course of 4 weeks Support may include: defining your marketing goals, determining the right marketing channels, messaging your program, branding, or defining your target audience Note: We devised this project to connect nonprofits and volunteers for more flexible, more immediate impact. We strongly suggest you start with 4 weeks and decide from there if youd like to continue working. Additional Details We are hosting our first Metaverse in December and want a marketing strategy for this event to attract participants willing to donate, individual donors to sponsor Veterans, and sponsors. Your Skills Digital Marketing Marketing Your Experience Experience working in/with marketing strategy in a professional capacity Your Availability Works remotely from anywhere 10-15 hours over 4 weeks Why Youll Love Volunteering With Us Enhance your skills while supporting a cause you care about Gain samples of work & references to add to your portfolio Directly impact a community organization on the ground Work remotely & create your own schedule Catchafire is committed to helping nonprofits affected by COVID-19 who need virtual volunteers now more than ever. (286, ' 285 --> PhD Deep interactive control of virtual characters motion based on separating identity, motion and style InterDigital, Inc. Rennes, Brittany, France About InterDigital InterDigital develops fundamental wireless technologies that are at the core of mobile devices, networks, and services worldwide. We solve many of the industrys most critical and complex technical challenges, providing solutions for more efficient broadband networks and a richer multimedia experience years ahead of market deployment. InterDigital has strategic relationships with many of the worlds leading wireless companies. Founded in 1972, InterDigital is listed on NASDAQ and is included in the S&P SmallCap 600 Index. PhD topic: Deep interactive control of virtual characters motion based on separating identity, motion and style Competencies computer animation, deep learning Description Character animation has a large set of potential applications, in videogames, movie industry, sports, rehabilitation, ergonomics, training, etc. Most of the available tools to animate virtual humans consist in specifying angular trajectories for each joint of a skeleton. The surface mesh of the character is then computed accordingly, using so-called skinning algorithms. However, being able to capture and reproduce the expressivity of a human motion is difficult, as it involves several subtle parameters, some of them being lost when modeling human performance as joint angles: angles, contacts on the body surface, velocity profiles, accelerations, distance or coordination between body parts, etc. With the development of robust body shape reconstruction based on cheap sensors, such as RGB cameras or depth sensors,directly manipulating the visible surface of the character has become a very active field of research. With the growing interest in persistent shared virtual worlds, such as the MetaVerse immersive social network, specific problems for character animation raised. Indeed, in these environments, the users are represented by avatars with different shape and morphology. The character animation platform should consequently be able to adapt the motion of the user to this different shape (retargetting problem), or adapt the identity of the avatar to make the user be recognizable by his/her friends, or change the style of the motion to convey a given emotion or adapt to the expecting behavior of the avatar. For example, a Hulk avatar is expecting to move with a specific style, but should also mimic the performance of the user. This PhD topic will investigate deep-learning methods to solve this retargeting problem while controlling the style. Location: Rennes, France - On Site InterDigital is an equal employment opportunity employer. InterDigital will not engage in or tolerate unlawful discrimination with regard to any employment decision, policy or practice based on a person’s sex, gender, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), age, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, military status, veteran status, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, assignments, evaluations, coaching, promotion, discipline, discharge and layoff. ______________________________________________________________________________________________________ About InterDigital InterDigital develops fundamental wireless technologies that are at the heart of mobile devices, networks and services around the world. We solve many of the industrys most critical and complex technical challenges, delivering solutions for more efficient broadband networks and a richer multimedia experience years before market deployment. InterDigital maintains strategic relationships with many of the worlds largest wireless carriers. Founded in 1972, InterDigital is listed on NASDAQ and is part of the S&P SmallCap 600 Index. Thesis subject: In-depth interactive control of virtual character movement based on the separation of identity, movement and style Skills Computer animation, deep learning Description Character animation has a wide range of potential applications, in video games, the film industry, sports, rehabilitation, ergonomics, training, etc. Most of the tools available to animate virtual humans consist of specifying angular trajectories for each joint of a skeleton. The mesh of the characters surface is then calculated accordingly, using so-called “skinning” algorithms. However, it is difficult to capture and reproduce the expressiveness of human movement, as it involves several subtle parameters, some of which are lost when modeling human performance such as joint angles: angles, surface contacts of the body, velocity profiles, accelerations, distance or coordination between body parts, etc. With the development of robust body shape reconstruction based on inexpensive sensors, such as RGB cameras or depth sensors, the direct manipulation of the characters visible surface has become a very active area of \u200b\u200bresearch. With the growing interest in persistent and shared virtual worlds, such as the immersive social network MetaVerse, issues specific to character animation have arisen. Indeed, in these environments, users are represented by avatars with different shapes and morphologies. The character animation platform must therefore be able to adapt the movement of the user to this different form (retargeting problem), or adapt the identity of the avatar so that the user is recognizable by his friends, or change the style of movement to convey a given emotion or fit the expected behavior of the avatar. For example, a Hulk avatar is expected to move with a specific style, but it must also mimic the users performance. This thesis topic will study deep learning methods to solve this retargeting problem while controlling the style. Location: Rennes, France - On site InterDigital is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. InterDigital prohibits unlawful discrimination and does not tolerate any employment decisions, policies or practices based on sex, gender, pregnancy (including childbirth, breastfeeding and medical condition) , age, race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, military status, veteran status, mental or physical disability, medical condition, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to recruiting, hiring, compensation, benefits, training, assignments, evaluations, coaching, promotion, discipline, dismissal and layoff. Testimony of a) former) intern Hello ! My name is Zoé, I have been working at Avanade for almost a year and a half now. I started as an intern at the Digital Factory on March 1, 2021, as part of my end-of-studies internship and continued on a permanent contract. As innovation and the field of research & development were close to my heart, this year I had the opportunity to work 40% internally on innovative and exciting subjects by integrating the Tech Office. I therefore carry out two activities in parallel, namely my mission with the client (GRDF?) and my activities for the Tech Office. What are your missions at Avanade? As mentioned previously, I carry out two activities jointly: At my client, I developed a chatbot integrated in Teams, using Microsofts Bot Framework SDK. The primary objective of the bot is to answer employees questions on internal tools and services, and on the tools of the Office 365 suite, as part of change management within the company. I am currently working on making it more “intelligent” by incorporating cognitive language understanding capabilities – AI – so that it can handle multiple scenarios. Within the Tech Office, I had the opportunity to work on different projects and explore many innovative topics. I started by working on a demonstrator centered around industrial IoT and intended for a trade show in which Avanade participates, called SIDO. The project includes different technologies such as "AI at Edge", IoT, digital twin, mixed and virtual reality, robotics, low-code, data processing, etc. I also helped design the Innovation Center in the Paris offices, thinking about the offer for Avanade customers and employees, its format (the "Innovation Journey") and its content (the demos , presentations etc). I then explored the subject of the "Metaverse" by working on the design and 3D modeling of virtual universes, to finally focus on extended reality technologies (AR, MR and VR) as well as project management. and team. What do you like about your missions? What I like the most is their diversity, I like to discover a new subject or a new technology. I also appreciate the freedom and autonomy I have to carry out my research and develop my applications. And obviously, all these experiences are very enriching both technically and interpersonally. What do you like about Avanade? Having the opportunity to train and improve your skills whatever your level is a real plus. I was also touched by the benevolence and mutual support between the employees. How did you discover Avanade? What made you choose Avanade? I discovered Avanade through a friend from my engineering school, who was already on a permanent contract when I was looking for a company to do my end-of-studies internship. What made me choose Avanade is the training opportunity, as well as the missions that I was presented with and on which I was going to be able to intervene. What were your missions during the internship? During this period I also worked on two subjects in parallel, the first was the development of a dual mobile and desktop application using the PowerPlatform (low-code/no-code technology), intended to facilitate the integration and assimilation of the knowledge acquired by the new joiners during their onboarding, and taking the form of a game in several parts. During this project I went through all the stages of the life cycle of a project, namely, the analysis and collection of needs, the POC, the costing, the writing of a backlog and the implementation of an Agile methodology, the development, the tests, the production and the writing of a documentation. The second project was the development of an AI as part of an application to learn sign language in mixed reality with a HoloLens 2 headset. For this innovative project, I alternated between development and research phases /reading scientific papers. Still have doubts? See the opinions of our former trainees on Happy Trainees (anonymous survey). Lets keep in touch ! Every day, our 59,000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients, their employees and their customers. We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60,000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies, we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges. We are a people first company, committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business, we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential. Majority owned by Accenture, Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com . ')

Responsibilities Research and technology planning in but not limited to: Deep Learning (DL) for math, DL system architecture and optimization, HPC for AI platform and optimization, Novel system architecture in autonomous driving, Blockchain technologies and Web3 systems, XR and Metaverse challenges and resolutions, Wide Area Network computing, Precision mobile charging systems, Dynamic low-light color imaging with QIS, Hierarchical edge-cloud privacy-preserved DL training, DL training with synthetic biology and silicon combo, In-switch network computing, Normalization of differential privacy. Generate patents, open-source contributions, papers, etc., in the above technical areas. (526, ' 525 --> Internship Program Nethermind London, England, United Kingdom (Remote) What are we all about? We are a team of world class builders and researchers with expertise across several domains: Ethereum Protocol Engineering, Layer-2, Decentralized Finance (DeFi), Miner Extractable Value (MEV), Smart Contract Development, Security Auditing and Formal Verification. Working to solve some of the most challenging problems in the blockchain space, we frequently collaborate with renowned companies, such as Ethereum Foundation, StarkWare, Gnosis Chain, Aave, Flashbots, xDai, Open Zeppelin, Forta Protocol, Energy Web, POA Network and many more. We actively contribute to Ethereum core development, EIPs and network upgrades together with the Ethereum Foundation, and other client teams. Today, there are nearly 200 of us working remotely from over 45+ countries. You can view all our open positions here: https://jobs.nethermind.io/ How does the internship program work and what makes it unique? Our interns will be given full autonomy, allowing them to decide whatever they want to do, experiment, and ask a lot of questions, and we will encourage and push our interns to succeed. This is a new area for me, can I have study time? We allow our interns the study time they require for anything related to what we do. What are the working hours? Our working hours are flexible to suit the requirements of the individual. In order to get the best out of the internship program, interns must be available for a minimum of 20 hours per week. Where is it located? We are a globally distributed team and we are a remote-first organization. Our entire team works fully remote. Is it paid? Yes, our internship program is paid. When does it start? Our internship program is open all year round and you can apply at any time. and we would like to inform you that we are no longer hiring interns this year, however the role is open and we will start interviewing and hiring from January What is the duration of the internship? The duration of the internship is flexible and can range from 1-3 months depending on the availability of the individual. Most of our interns stay on the program for 3 months. Do you hold a daily stand-up meeting? Yes. Each team holds their own daily stand-up meeting to discuss what each member of the team is working on and an opportunity to ask questions. Will I have a mentor? Yes. All interns are assigned a mentor where they can seek help and guidance. What tool do you use for communication? We use Slack daily and it is our primary medium of communication. All interns are added to our Slack workspace. What projects can I work on? Throughout the duration of the internship, our interns can work on one or more of the following projects depending on the skills, knowledge, and preference of the individual: Nubia https://www.cairo-lang.org/ https://ethereum.org/en/developers/docs/layer-2-scaling/ The aim of project Nubia is to deliver an L2-based solutions for DeFi. It leverages Cairo language and the platform provided by StarkWare to make this happen. Skills that you will use and learn at the Nubia team include but not limited to: Low level programming (assembler skills, C / embedded devices programming), CairoLang Compilers / LLVM / assembly code / runtimes EVM (Ethereum Virtual Machine) compiler Abstract algebra Cryptography ZKP (Zero-Knowledge Proofs) Solidity programming Financial mathematics (Options pricing, Monte Carlo simulations) Gauss The Gauss team focuses on security auditing of Smart Contracts. The team supports clients to achieve higher levels of confidence in the security and robustness of their system relying on manual review and different tools to check for possible vulnerabilities in the code and design.Skills that you will use and learn in the Gauss team included but not limited to: Programming skills in Solidity and Cairo; Comprehension of the ecosystems where Smart Contracts interact (Ethereum and StarkNet). Understanding of common attack patterns in the space; Understanding of the most common Blockchain applications; Different tools like Slither, Echidna, Etherscan, and Tenderly; Written and verbal communication skills in the English language; Ability to diagnose bugs in complex Blockchain systems. To learn more about smart contracts security auditing internship program, please apply and we will get back to you. Synnax The Synnax team aims to bring formal verification to any other team at Nethermind that may need it. We leverage the Lean proof assistant to formally verify smart contracts, compilers, etc... Our current focus is on verifying the Warp compiler. Skills that you will use and learn in the Synnax team include but not limited to: Writing formal specifications in Lean Formally specifying programming languages. (Solidity, Yul, EVM, Cairo, etc...) Formal specifications of distributed systems Cryptography, Zero-Knowledge Proofs and Abstract Algebra Collaborating with both internal and external customers and the teams responsible for the actual implementation Publishing and presenting research results both internally and externally Links: https://leanprover.github.io/ https://github.com/NethermindEth/Yul-Specification https://medium.com/nethermind-eth/securing-warp-a-formal-specification-of-the-yul-ir-85bb3bf51c62 https://github.com/NethermindEth/warp Ethereum 1 https://ethereum.org/en/ https://github.com/NethermindEth/nethermind Eth1 is the original team of Ethereum protocol engineering at Nethermind. Nethermind is a full Ethereum client implementation written in C# .NET. It runs on all major platforms supporting Ethereum mainnet, Clique, and AuRa chains, as well as xDAI, Energy Web, and private networks. The Nethermind client comes with additional features, such as Prometheus/Grafana dashboards, seq enterprise logging, and complete JSON RPC, including two formats of tracing. Moreover, it offers a variety of advanced built-in plugins notably Baseline and MEV. Skills that you will use and learn at the Ethereum 1 team include but are not limited to: Technical perspective .NET 6 Distributed networks (P2P) Performance and memory optimizations EVM / TransactionPool / JSON RPC Complex data structures Patricia/Merkle/Verkle tries RocksDB Broader perspective Work on EIPs with Ethereum Foundation and wider Ethereum community Work on Ethereum extensions Open source development Sparta https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Decentralized_finance https://medium.com/flashbots/frontrunning-the-mev-crisis-40629a613752 The Sparta team is focusing on tx pool and DeFi transactions analysis for arbitrage purposes. Skills that you will use and learn at the MEV ****(Miner Extractable Value) ****team include but not limited to: Ethereum transaction pool Decentralized finance (DeFi) Financial arbitrage Mining pool operations Angkor https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DevOps This Angkor team is responsible for processes related to product development operations. PhD internships Synnax The Synnax team aims to formally verify as much of the Ethereum ecosystem as we can: Solidity smart contracts, Cairo smart contracts, protocols, compilers, etc. We work with both external clients and other teams at Nethermind. We develop and apply formal verification tools and leverage the Lean proof assistant to formally verify smart contracts, compilers, etc. Skills that you will use and learn in the Synnax team include but not limited to: Publishing and presenting research results both internally and externally Collaborating with both internal and external customers and the teams responsible for the implementations being verified Writing formal specifications in Lean Writing formal verification tools (SMT checkers, Horn solvers, proof assistant libraries, etc) Formally specifying programming languages. (Solidity, Yul, EVM, Cairo, etc) Formal specifications of distributed systems Cryptography, Zero-Knowledge Proofs and Abstract Algebra Links: https://leanprover.github.io/https://github.com/NethermindEth/Yul-Specification https://medium.com/nethermind-eth/securing-warp-a-formal-specification-of-the-yul-ir-85bb3bf51c62 https://github.com/NethermindEth/warp Nineveh In the Nineveh research team, we investigate cryptography developments to make Ethereum a better, safer and more private place. Some exemplary projects we are engaged in are: Hybrid proof systems from SNARKs and STARKs. In this project, we combine techniques from SNARKs and STARKs to build hybrid proof systems enjoying the bests of both worlds. SNARKs allow for short (constant-size) proofs and have efficient verifiers, on the other had, they require trusted setup. zkSTARKs are transparent (dont rely on a trusted setup) and have efficient prover while paying the price of longer proof size (logarithmic to the size of the proven statement) and verifiers complexity. We investigate use of STARK-related primitives like FRI to give zkSNARKs more efficient provers and reduce security assumptions used. In the nearest future we plan to implement our hybrid schemes to show the world concrete efficiency gains our approach brings. Secure storage for mnemonic keys. The common problem of using secret keys is that they may be stolen or lost, causing for example, losing access to staked funds. Here, we build an application that allows users to securely distribute the key into so-called shares such that only large enough set of the shares can be used to reconstruct the secret and someone who knows too few secrets shares learns nothing. We achieve that by using Shamirs secret sharing scheme. Importantly both the secret and the shares are represented by easy to remember mnemonic. Security analysis of proof systems. In this project, we analyse security properties of existing zkSNARKs to verify whether they are sufficiently secure for such a complex environments that blockchains are. To that end, we use provable security methods. Additionally, we analyse existing zkSNARKs and name their security gaps. We show where efficiency-oriented efforts make proof systems unusable due to security vulnerabilities. Towards more efficient and secure polynomial commitments. Polynomial commitment schemes are going to lay the ground for Ethereums data availability in the future. Hence, one of our research task is to investigate novel polynomial commitment schemes that are better than Kate et al commitment scheme in terms of security and efficiency. Towards more fair MEV. On of the potential security measure one can take to mitigate malicious MEV extraction attacks is by obfuscating submitted transactions. In this project, we investigate use of privacy preserving tools to assure more fair MEV. Our team is looking for two kinds of people: Cryptography enthusiasts who would enjoy analysing, breaking and designing cryptographic schemes. Engineers with some background in cryptography who enjoy making proof of concepts of novel cryptographic protocols, extending cryptographic libraries, and finding vulnerabilities in existing implementations. Skills that you will use and learn at the Nineveh research team include but not limited to: basic algebra cryptography -- provable security, cryptographic protocols (esp. zero-knowledge ones) MEV distributed systems C++ / Rust / Python Heres what some of our current interns have to say: "Im super excited with this opportunity to take part in such an important project and to work with a team of really talented people. Not only it gives me a chance to learn a lot but also, Ill be able to help in solving real world problems" Carmen Irene Cabrera Rodríguez, Cairo and Layer 2 Research Intern, Nubia team "The Nethermind internship is like selling your soul to the devil. You dont know what youre getting yourself into at first, but by doing it you get some pretty rad powers with which to flex on mere mortals" Kristof Gazso, Ethereum and MEV Research Intern, MEV and Ethereum 1 team "Working at Nethermind is nothing short of a journey, every day is a new challenge to learn and grow. The projects are incredibly exciting, and the dedication and grit of the team is unstoppable" Guilherme Heise, Blockchain Data Engineering Intern, Data team "I recently started an internship at Nethermind, and I can say that, it is one of the best professional experiences I have ever had. Wonderful co-workers, projects on blockchain, DeFi, Ethereum and much more. Manticore recently enabled the next evolution of the Core Metaverse by integrating MetaMask and OpenSea, setting a new standard for NFT utility in the metaverse. Users connect their Metamesk crypto wallet to their Core account, allowing them to ascribe any utility and feature in Core to NFT ownership. Core has also integrated with OpenSea, the world’s largest marketplace for NFTs, and created an API that can read, display, and create content based on any NFT on the Ethereum blockchain. Trend Micro’s Forward Looking Threat Research team (FTR) is a global team of Senior Researchers tasked with scouting the the likely future risks in security by researching what: • Cybercriminals are working on today (Underground and Deepweb, Targeted Attacks / APT and Malware research) • How the users / victims are using the web (Social Networks, New emerging services, etc) • What technologies are available now and in the future (e.g. IOT, Web3 / Metaverse, Spread of Mobile OS, Blockchain) This FTR researcher role will be responsible for focusing on the threats that will affect emerging Web3 technologies, in particular on Blockchain based attacks on Smart Contracts, DeFi and the upcoming systems that will be built on top of them. They will also be expected to look into higher layers of the emerging Web such as Metaverse security concerns. This role will not be purely focused on the technologies involved, but also combine this by looking at real world attacks that we would expect to see coming from financially motivated criminals and espionage focused targeted attacks / APT in this new web paradigm. The ideal candidate will both have a good understanding of todays cybercrime threat landscape, but also a passion for the underlying technologies of Web3 – and be able to develop research on where we expect new user behavior, technology and criminal business models to evolve to in the period of 1-3 years. The FTR researcher is also responsible for researching local matters – such as unique user behaviors, crimes or emerging technologies in certain countries. They will be expected to interface with government agencies, law enforcement, ISPs, CERTs, universities and other research groups for research, disclosure, and knowledge sharing. This position requires the researcher to represent Trend Micro in external conferences, either as an attendee or as a speaker. As the team is globally distributed the successful candidate must be willing to travel for global meetings and conferences. Some of FTR externally published work can be found at: http://us.trendmicro.com/us/trendwatch/research-and-analysis/white-papers-and-articles/index.html Desired Experiences and Skills: Bachelor’s degree or Higher strongly preferred, or strong self taught and proven skillset. (481, ' 480 --> Software developer C++ / Unreal Engine viality AG Dortmund, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany (Hybrid) WE ARE LOOKING FOR: Software Developer C++ / Unreal Engine (m/f/d) Creating the future – at viacity Teaser: We are looking for an (experienced) Unreal developer with C++ knowledge for long-term support of the viality team in the development of e.g. VR training and simulation applications for B2C and B2A customers. About viality viality AG was spun off from the university in Dortmund in 2009 and has since developed into one of Germanys leading providers of virtual reality, augmented reality, digital twin and metaverse solutions. The focus is primarily on customers from the automotive and industrial sectors, as well as players in trade and the public sector. Innovation and interdisciplinarity are very important to us. Because it is only through the right interaction of developers, designers, artists, engineers and consultants that value-added solutions can be created that work for people. Therefore, we combine the classic skills of a technology company with the skills of a concept agency and, if desired, accompany the customer from the first idea to go-live. Our corporate culture Even before Corona, flexible working, e.g. through home office or flat hierarchies, was commonplace for us. We live new work. But sometimes projects also require on-site work - either at the customers or in the viaity studio in Dortmund. The presence is rewarded with access to top hardware, friendly colleagues and all other little things that are helpful for the project success. We also live innovation. Our work is characterized by the constant search for what is technically feasible. We often research the latest approaches and technologies in research projects and translate these findings into value-added offers for the economy. Accordingly, we are all united by curiosity and enthusiasm for the topics related to VR, AR, Digital Twin, Metaverse. This always results in a wide variety of projects. areas of responsibility As (Senior) Unreal Developer (m/f/d) you will support the development team with your expertise in Unreal Engine and C++ and you will be responsible for the implementation and expansion of virtual reality training and simulation applications with this engine. The connection of sensors or individual input devices often plays a role. The aim is to create user-friendly and error-free applications and to constantly expand them. In addition to technical expertise in software and hardware, social skills are also of great importance: thinking along conceptually, making technologies and trends understandable or even advising customers - these are everyday tasks. We are also happy if you show the viaity team new ways and possibilities and satisfy our curiosity. 🙂 your profile (Completed) studies in computer science Experience coding with C++ Experience working with the Unreal Engine Knowledge of English desirable Feel for UI/UX desirable Experience with CryEngine / Unity is an advantage Experience with VR development is an advantage what we offer Exciting, demanding and varied activities A young, dynamic team Flexible working hours Home office possible Company hardware for private use Team-Events 30 days holiday do you find yourself again Apply now! If you see yourself in this job description, the topics appeal to you, our corporate culture appeals to you and you have the required skills, we look forward to receiving your application! Questions? Just call! 🙂 Our recruiter Martin Dieck is looking forward to seeing you! Mail: jobs@viality.de Subject: Application software developer C++ / Unreal Engine Mobil: +4917657908946 ')

As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. ')
(493, ' 492 --> Metaverse Studio Operations Lead Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in our Accenture Technology Vision 2022. The work: The Studio Operations Lead will be responsible for making sure the studio team can have everything that they need to perform at their best. This includes overseeing the budget, procuring tools related to agile development with the production team, validating the pipeline with the studio head and the production team, procuring tools and software for the 3D artist and development teams. Once the teams are up and running, you’ll manage the metrics of the studio and make sure everything is running efficiently. What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 5 years of experience in an operational role managing financials preferably within a creative studio, the gaming industry, immersive media, narrative design, or location-based entertainment space. Minimum 2 years’ experience overseeing and managing a significant studio budget Bonus points if you have Strong understanding of production environment within a studio that produces interactive content Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Knowledge of 3D art, programming, and other skills related to game development or production Experience leading and motivating a creative team to produce their best work Ability to manage financial expectations and timelines with clients and to be able to manage workloads across the studios Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. ')
(498, ' 497 --> Metaverse Studio Operations Lead Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in our Accenture Technology Vision 2022. The work: The Studio Operations Lead will be responsible for making sure the studio team can have everything that they need to perform at their best. This includes overseeing the budget, procuring tools related to agile development with the production team, validating the pipeline with the studio head and the production team, procuring tools and software for the 3D artist and development teams. Once the teams are up and running, you’ll manage the metrics of the studio and make sure everything is running efficiently. What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 5 years of experience in an operational role managing financials preferably within a creative studio, the gaming industry, immersive media, narrative design, or location-based entertainment space. Minimum 2 years’ experience overseeing and managing a significant studio budget Bonus points if you have Strong understanding of production environment within a studio that produces interactive content Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Knowledge of 3D art, programming, and other skills related to game development or production Experience leading and motivating a creative team to produce their best work Ability to manage financial expectations and timelines with clients and to be able to manage workloads across the studios Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in our Accenture Technology Vision 2022. The work: The Studio Operations Lead will be responsible for making sure the studio team can have everything that they need to perform at their best. This includes overseeing the budget, procuring tools related to agile development with the production team, validating the pipeline with the studio head and the production team, procuring tools and software for the 3D artist and development teams. Once the teams are up and running, you’ll manage the metrics of the studio and make sure everything is running efficiently. What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 5 years of experience in an operational role managing financials preferably within a creative studio, the gaming industry, immersive media, narrative design, or location-based entertainment space. Minimum 2 years’ experience overseeing and managing a significant studio budget Bonus points if you have Strong understanding of production environment within a studio that produces interactive content Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Knowledge of 3D art, programming, and other skills related to game development or production Experience leading and motivating a creative team to produce their best work Ability to manage financial expectations and timelines with clients and to be able to manage workloads across the studios Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. ')
(504, ' 503 --> Metaverse Studio Operations Lead Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. The work: The Studio Operations Lead will be responsible for making sure the studio team can have everything that they need to perform at their best. This includes overseeing the budget, procuring tools related to agile development with the production team, validating the pipeline with the studio head and the production team, procuring tools and software for the 3D artist and development teams. Once the teams are up and running, you’ll manage the metrics of the studio and make sure everything is running efficiently. What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 5 years of experience in an operational role managing financials preferably within a creative studio, the gaming industry, immersive media, narrative design, or location-based entertainment space. Minimum 2 years’ experience overseeing and managing a significant studio budget Bonus points if you have Strong understanding of production environment within a studio that produces interactive content Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Knowledge of 3D art, programming, and other skills related to game development or production Experience leading and motivating a creative team to produce their best work Ability to manage financial expectations and timelines with clients and to be able to manage workloads across the studios Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. ')
(509, ' 508 --> Metaverse Studio Operations Lead Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in our Accenture Technology Vision 2022. The work: The Studio Operations Lead will be responsible for making sure the studio team can have everything that they need to perform at their best. This includes overseeing the budget, procuring tools related to agile development with the production team, validating the pipeline with the studio head and the production team, procuring tools and software for the 3D artist and development teams. Once the teams are up and running, you’ll manage the metrics of the studio and make sure everything is running efficiently. What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 5 years of experience in an operational role managing financials preferably within a creative studio, the gaming industry, immersive media, narrative design, or location-based entertainment space. Minimum 2 years’ experience overseeing and managing a significant studio budget Bonus points if you have Strong understanding of production environment within a studio that produces interactive content Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Knowledge of 3D art, programming, and other skills related to game development or production Experience leading and motivating a creative team to produce their best work Ability to manage financial expectations and timelines with clients and to be able to manage workloads across the studios Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities.
