What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. ')
(514, ' 513 --> Metaverse Studio Operations Lead Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in our Accenture Technology Vision 2022. The work: The Studio Operations Lead will be responsible for making sure the studio team can have everything that they need to perform at their best. This includes overseeing the budget, procuring tools related to agile development with the production team, validating the pipeline with the studio head and the production team, procuring tools and software for the 3D artist and development teams. Once the teams are up and running, you’ll manage the metrics of the studio and make sure everything is running efficiently. What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 5 years of experience in an operational role managing financials preferably within a creative studio, the gaming industry, immersive media, narrative design, or location-based entertainment space. Minimum 2 years’ experience overseeing and managing a significant studio budget Bonus points if you have Strong understanding of production environment within a studio that produces interactive content Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Knowledge of 3D art, programming, and other skills related to game development or production Experience leading and motivating a creative team to produce their best work Ability to manage financial expectations and timelines with clients and to be able to manage workloads across the studios Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. Develop and maintain automated build and continuous integration systems. Use the latest cloud, automation, continuous integration, monitoring, and container technologies. Ensure the smooth operation of and participation in emergency response situations for outages in our infrastructure. Assess our current development and deployment processes, design and document architecture and migration plans, and ensure our team successfully implements them. Implement best practices and cost optimization strategies. Communicate and suggest new ideas and designs in both written and verbal formats Be part of the web3 revolution! Learn, learn, and learn. Job Requirements You’re a collaborative team player who rolls up your sleeves, responds quickly and decisively, is flexible and open to change, and is able to productively work with the team to achieve company objectives. You have high attention to detail and love to learn and solve complex engineering problems and are open and enthusiastic to learn about new technology when required. In particular, you have: At least 2 years of relevant DevOps experience. Solid experience in AWS, Kubernetes, and working with micro-service architecture. Experience with the SCRUM methodologies, and CI/CD (CircleCI, GitHub actions). Familiarity with the latest cloud, automation, continuous integration, monitoring, and container technologies. Experience building MVPs with future improvements in mind, and not being afraid to move forward with existing deficiencies to be improved later. Experience with backing up, provisioning & disaster recovery production databases. Seasoned with Linux systems. Full professional level of English is mandatory. What We Offer Competitive compensation package. Latest generation equipment. Flexible work environment: REMOTE if you are far from Cataluña OR combine home office and vibrant office life (hybrid modality with a flexible schedule). Stylish office with a terrace and panoramic views in the Barcelona beach area (22@, metro Marina / Bogatell). Free lunches with the team twice per week. Unlimited coffee and tea in the office. Work in an open-minded, dynamic, and international team of highly qualified professionals. A company culture that is respectful and empathetic, while being innovative and challenging. Flat company organization where everyone gets their say. Possibility to progress and evolve within the company. Continuous training opportunities. Team events, after-work celebrations, and company offsites in great locations. ')

(564, ' 563 --> Metaverse Studio Operations Lead Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in our Accenture Technology Vision 2022. The work: The Studio Operations Lead will be responsible for making sure the studio team can have everything that they need to perform at their best. This includes overseeing the budget, procuring tools related to agile development with the production team, validating the pipeline with the studio head and the production team, procuring tools and software for the 3D artist and development teams. Once the teams are up and running, you’ll manage the metrics of the studio and make sure everything is running efficiently. What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 5 years of experience in an operational role managing financials preferably within a creative studio, the gaming industry, immersive media, narrative design, or location-based entertainment space. Minimum 2 years’ experience overseeing and managing a significant studio budget Bonus points if you have Strong understanding of production environment within a studio that produces interactive content Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel Knowledge of 3D art, programming, and other skills related to game development or production Experience leading and motivating a creative team to produce their best work Ability to manage financial expectations and timelines with clients and to be able to manage workloads across the studios Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. (575, ' 574 --> Bell Labs - Metaverse Researcher Nokia Budapest, Budapest, Hungary (Hybrid) Come create the technology that helps the world act together Nokia is committed to innovation and technology leadership across mobile, fixed and cloud networks. Your career here will have a positive impact on people’s lives and will help us build the capabilities needed for a more productive, sustainable, and inclusive world. We challenge ourselves to create an inclusive way of working where we are open to new ideas, empowered to take risks and fearless to bring our authentic selves to work. The team youll be part of The AI Semantic Reasoning and Understanding (AI-SR&U) team creates ground-breaking research in various areas of spatial computing, namely visual localization, semantic segmentation and scene understanding for industrial environments, with the long term mandate to put together the enablers of an industrial metaverse with a strong emphasis on intertwining the physical with the digital. We are part of the AI Research Lab with an established record of ground-breaking research into problems of direct industrial and scientific impact. Nokia Bell Labs is the world-renowned research arm of Nokia, having invented many of the foundational technologies that underpin information and communications networks and all digital devices and systems. This research has produced nine Nobel Prizes, five Turing Awards and numerous other awards. What You Will Learn And Contribute To We are looking for researchers able to advance the state of the art in technologies for the industrial metaverse and put them into use in the context of building industrial metaverses. Successful candidates are able to build and scale prototypes using technologies ranging from computer vision algorithms for 3D computational photography to neural rendering scene reconstruction to computational imaging visual-inertial odometry, state estimation, sensor fusion, mapping and localization to natural language processing, language grounding and interaction technologies In your work, you will focus on key aspects of these technologies, create research papers, patent applications and research prototypes. In addition, you will broadly cooperate with Bell Labs researchers from our lab and other research labs, working on distinct aspects of the metaverse to advance the state of the art in research, with development teams on taking your prototypes to the next level of maturity and towards productization. You will also collaborate with architects and technical leads from our business units. Your Skills And Experience You would be a great fit for this role if you had: PhD degree in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Applied Mathematics, or a related field (e.g., Computer Vision, Natural Language Processing) Strong research record in top conferences/journals dealing with technologies relevant for the metaverse Background in data science, experience in developing AI/ML applications Experience with software development with one or more general programming languages (e.g., Java, C/C++, C#, Python, JavaScript, or Go) It would be nice if you also had: Excellent written communication skills, and excellent verbal skills, possibly manifested through videos of your talks (from conferences, seminars, TED talks, keynote speeches, interviews or any other types of public videos of you as a technical person/researcher) Innate curiosity to continuously learn, deepen and widen your skills and propensity to relentlessly follow the state of the art in your field of research Strong self-motivation to continuously innovate Proven record of coding skills in technologies relevant for the metaverse, materialized in either a Github (or other) account, with a healthy mix and number of meaningful contributions, or authorship of papers with code etc What We Offer Nokia offers flexible and working schemes, continuous learning opportunities, well-being programs to support you mentally and physically, opportunities to join and get supported by employee resource groups, mentoring programs and highly diverse teams with an inclusive culture where people thrive and are empowered Joining Nokia Hungary will make you eligible for the following additional benefits: Flexible working hours - the core time is between 9:30 and 15:30 Flexible fringe benefit system (cafeteria) Laptop and mobile phone (with SIM card) Company car or cash allowance Yearly performance bonus Risk, life, and accident insurance On-site doctor with various preventive services and health screening programs Fully equipped gym, sauna and fitness programs Personal Support Service (PSS) – free access to confidential and professional support and guidance on a range of emotional, practical and work-life topics E-learning platforms such as NokiaEDU, Harvard ManageMentor, LinkedIn Learning etc. at your disposal for certified technical training and personal development Everyday Excellence – Employee Recognition Program (awards can be redeemed via our online store) Share in Success - Nokia’s voluntary employee share purchase plan Nokia is committed to inclusion and is an equal opportunity employer Nokia has received the following recognitions for its commitment to inclusion & equality: One of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by Ethisphere Gender-Equality Index by Bloomberg Workplace Pride Global Benchmark LGBT+ equality & best place to work by HRC Foundation At Nokia, we act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Nokia’s employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. (579, ' 578 --> Modern Workplace Pre-sales Architect avnade Edinburgh, Scotland, United Kingdom About Us Job Description Want to create value with digital and turn your ideas into human impact? So do we. At Avanade our vision is to be the leading innovator in Workplace Experience by 2023, creating impactful and motivational Employee and Customer Experiences through the power of the Microsoft ecosystem. We help clients to re-imagine their Workplace Experience (WX) encompassing technology, employee experience and business operations to remove cultural barriers, unlock new sources of value and drive sustainable growth. By joining Avanade’s Modern Workplace community, you will have a fantastic opportunity to operate at the forefront of technology, with access to global clients, on challenging and exciting projects. We are a diverse team, and we are proud of our culture that welcomes every individual. In our team you will find talented and passionate technologists, with a collaborative, positive can-do attitude. If you are the type of person who thrives on constantly learning and challenging yourself with a genuine desire to do your best, then you could be successful here. Our promise is to invest in you and help give you the platform for continuous learning and career development. About the Role: Avanade’s Modern Workplace Solution Area is responsible for making our Workplace vision a reality through three focused offerings: Workplace Platform Modernization – modernizing and extend the workplace technology ecosystem to protect against attacks, supporting new ways of working and drive increased business value. Workplace Value Realization – releasing business value through reimagined culture and employee experience, transforming business operations by reconfiguring how work gets done. Workplace Managed Services – managing and continuously evolving the workplace technology ecosystem to support new ways of working and deliver increased business value. Sales and solutioning for these offerings is also supported by a centre of excellence (COE) team that works with global, area (Europe) and regional (UK) offering, sales and delivery leads. CTO Advisory addresses all the technological and organizational transformations of Chief Technology Officers. We therefore work hand in hand with consultants from sectoral practices, within multi-specialist teams, in order to address all of these transformation challenges. Within CTO Advisory, our Future of Work team brings together our know-how around technological themes, adoption and organization related to the digital work environment, and in particular around the following issues: Collaboration and Citizen IT: How to support the digitization of businesses and promote collaboration within teams? Emerging technologies: What opportunities and use cases for emerging technologies (Metaverse, AI, etc.) in a professional context? Our mission is securing the web3 world. Blockchain technology and smart contracts are the future of finance, underpinning web3 and the metaverse. Vulnerabilities and bugs in this software regularly put millions of dollars at stake. Our goal is to automatically find these vulnerabilities and bugs before the software is deployed on the blockchain using advanced static analysis. We are looking for experienced software engineers who are passionate about software quality and security and want to advance the state-of-the-art of smart contract static analysis. Join us on our mission of making the new digital world a safer place! What You Will Do As part of our multinational team of programming language, static analysis and formal methods experts, you will design and implement tools that automatically find vulnerabilities and other issues in smart contracts and blockchain source code, using various static analysis techniques such as abstract interpretation, dataflow analysis, function modeling, and inter-procedural/global analyses. You will have the opportunity to work on all stages of tool development from idea generation to implementation and iterative improvements. We have positions available at all levels of seniority. Title and responsibilities will be commensurate with experience and background. Our team is highly supportive and collaborative with great opportunities to learn and grow. You are comfortable with the unknown and understand that #startuplife means that you may wear multiple hats. Design, prototype, and implement new abstract interpretation models and decision procedures. Understand the semantics of various programming languages and translate them to intermediate representations. Research new static analysis techniques and apply theories to practice. Experience with static analysis techniques or formal methods such as abstract interpretation, dataflow analysis, model checking, theorem provers, decision procedures and SAT/SMT solvers. CertiK’s mission is to secure the cyber world. Starting with blockchain, CertiK applies cutting-edge innovations from academia into enterprise, enabling mission-critical applications to be built with security and correctness. (719, ' 718 --> Software Developer VoIP (Go / Rust) Element Berlin, Berlin, Germany (Remote) Who We Are Element is the startup that employs the core team behind matrix.org— the leading project for secure, open decentralised communication. Matrix’s mission is to make messaging as open as email — allowing everyone to choose where their data is hosted, enjoy private conversations thanks to advanced encryption, and ultimately be in control of their own communication. Matrix powers Element, our flagship messaging apps for the web, iOS & Android, along with Element Matrix Services (EMS), our SaaS platform for personal & professional use. We build things for everyone, and we know we can’t succeed without a diverse team. Our hiring process is designed to be humane and give candidates the best chance to show us what you can do. If we ever fall down on this, please let us know. The Role Element is heavily investing in building out Matrix as the missing signalling layer for WebRTC: providing an open and decentralised E2EE transport for negotiating media streams and data channels. On top, we have recently extended Matrix to support scalable decentralised E2EE group voice and video calling too (MSC3401). These are the base building blocks for visionary applications such as Element Call as well as the open metaverse (aka third room). Similar to the concept of bridges between matrix and classical messenger applications, we are also aiming for bridging real-time media applications to connect to more legacy systems, e.g., SIP / PSTN, as we are trying to work on interoperability with a unified collaboration & communication vision. The VoIP team will be responsible for designing and implementing a Matrix MSC3401 compatible backend including a generic bridging model. Currently Element Call cannot interop with other VoIP platforms. You’d come along to help evolve the backend and add one of the first bridges to interop with, e.g., SIP / PSTN, using a modern tech stack that ensures future compatibility. Our VoIP team ensures that there is a communication layer for an open metaverse, so this is a great chance to make a big impact on the future of communication. Since (almost) everything we do is open source you can get a great feel for exactly what it would be like to work on the team, come and say hi! Requirements As part of our VoIP Team you are fascinated by real-time audio and video processing. You enjoy exciting challenges and work scientifically on cutting-edge technologies. You will be responsible for developing audio / video infrastructure components and services. Your ideas and work will improve our real-time communication platform which is used by several million users per day. The most important thing is that you believe passionately in the mission of decentralisation of the internet. More specifically that you believe that communications should not be centralised in the hands of a small number of very large organisations and instead individuals should control their own data and choose who they share it with. As a Front-end expert, you determine new Designs (Domain modelling) and you have a chance that the whole world will soon use your Front-end solutions! The quality of code is high and the people you can spar with excel in their knowledge! As a team, you will sometimes come out and participate, for example, in Hackathons and Algorithm contests. Chances are you and the team of smart minds will go home with the win! The culture is characterized as open, and informal and there is also a lot of time and attention to personal development! Transparency In Coverage Health plan price transparency is designed to help consumers know the cost of covered items or healthcare-related services prior to the date upon which they receive care. Transparency in Coverage (TIC) regulations require health insurers and group health plans to create machine readable files (MRFs) that contain the negotiated rates for in-network providers and allowed amounts derived from historical claims for out-of-network providers and make those files publicly available. Here is the link to the site on which Kaiser Permanente posts its in-network and out-of-network allowed amount machine-readable files (MRFs). (758, ' 757 --> Software Engineer (Senior to Principal) - Static Analysis CertiK Seattle, WA (Remote) Why us? CertiK is the leader in blockchain security. Our mission is securing the web3 world. Blockchain technology and smart contracts are the future of finance, underpinning web3 and the metaverse. Vulnerabilities and bugs in this software regularly put millions of dollars at stake. Our goal is to automatically find these vulnerabilities and bugs before the software is deployed on the blockchain using advanced static analysis. We are looking for experienced software engineers who are passionate about software quality and security and want to advance the state-of-the-art of smart contract static analysis. Join us on our mission of making the new digital world a safer place! What You Will Do As part of our multinational team of programming language, static analysis and formal methods experts, you will design and implement tools that automatically find vulnerabilities and other issues in smart contracts and blockchain source code, using various static analysis techniques such as abstract interpretation, dataflow analysis, function modeling, and inter-procedural/global analyses. You will have the opportunity to work on all stages of tool development from idea generation to implementation and iterative improvements. We have positions available at all levels of seniority. Title and responsibilities will be commensurate with experience and background. Our team is highly supportive and collaborative with great opportunities to learn and grow. About You You have a background in programming languages and programming tools and want to work on the forefront of applying results from research. You like to tackle challenging problems and have a track record of achieving results, where results are people using your tool to do their jobs. You are collaborative: you share ideas, love to brainstorm with peers, and give and receive feedback. You are comfortable with the unknown and understand that #startuplife means that you may wear multiple hats. Responsibilities Research, develop, and extend vulnerability detectors, working closely with blockchain experts. Design, prototype, and implement new abstract interpretation models and decision procedures. Understand the semantics of various programming languages and translate them to intermediate representations. Research new static analysis techniques and apply theories to practice. Write tests covering all possible execution paths of your code Required Qualifications Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field, or an equivalent experience. Minimum of 4 years of software development experience (including internship and academic/professional research). Clear understanding of programming language semantics and related concepts such as AST and CFG. Preferred Qualifications PhD in static analysis or the broader field of automated reasoning. Experience with static analysis techniques or formal methods such as abstract interpretation, dataflow analysis, model checking, theorem provers, decision procedures and SAT/SMT solvers. Strong and creative problem-solving skills; always willing to learn and embrace new technologies and to collaborate. Prior experience in a professional software development environment. About The Company Founded in 2018 by professors of Yale University and Columbia University, CertiK is a pioneer in blockchain security, utilizing best-in-class technology to secure and monitor blockchain protocols and smart contracts. CertiK’s mission is to secure the cyber world. Starting with blockchain, CertiK applies cutting-edge innovations from academia into enterprise, enabling mission-critical applications to be built with security and correctness. We provide flexible paid-time off. We provide a 401(k) with a 4% company match starting from your first day. Compensation is negotiable, depending on level of experience - $115,000 - $230,000 base salary. Our mission is to create realistic environments that empower more engaging and real-to-life interactions, free from physical limitations thanks to the inherent anytime-anywhere feature of the metaverse. People and businesses are in need of a solution to bridge the divide between physical and digital reality. Companies and their customers are struggling to align the experiences of in-person, hybrid, and remote interactions. Mytaverse enables its customers to deploy digital twins of their products in their own branded and photo-realistic 3D settings such as in showrooms or innovation labs. Our technology is also being used for meetings, conferences, exhibitions and for the training of employees through job simulations. Really, we are only limited by one’s imagination. We are looking for a Game Tech Team Lead to contribute to the growth of our company. This is an opportunity to lead our work with Unreal, cloud streaming, and other cutting-edge gaming technology. Guides team members to create work that adheres to the design of game systems while maintaining good style and optimization standards. Involved in project management decisions and collaborates with project managers, other team leads, and the CTO to plan out projects. Supports interdepartmental teams to complete assigned projects on time, to specifications, and with efficiency. Develops software to integrate with distributed web applications. Performs root cause analysis for production errors, and investigates and resolves technical issues. Delegates work and assignments to team members based on expertise, work experience, and time constraints. Addresses questions and/or concerns throughout the project. Collaborates across time zones via Slack, GitHub comments, Jira, documents, and video calls. Understands the needs of stakeholders and conveys this to the rest of the Game Tech team. At least five years of relevant experience as a Game Developer or similar software engineering role. At least two years of experience developing optimized modules in C++ within Unreal. Strong knowledge of C++. Proficient with git and git workflows. Experience building libraries and APIs. Up-to-date with the latest gaming trends, techniques, best practices and technologies. We look forward to that Completed degree in business informatics, computer science, industrial engineering or comparable First professional experience (1+ years) in the field of digital identities (consulting, development, etc.) Good understanding of the concepts of Self-Sovereign Identity, IAM, Blockchain and Smart Contracts Overview of developments at EU level regarding the eIDAS regulation Practice in IT architecture, management consulting and basic programming skills Ideally know-how in digital/self-sovereign identity frameworks such as Hyperledger Indy/Aries and fluent English and German Your benefits at Accenture You as a person are important to us. (795, ' 794 --> *Adobe Content and Commerce – Practice Manager* Accenture Australia Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia This role is to drive a practice across JAPAC, MEA and LatAm for Adobe Content and Commerce to provide varying levels support for Market Units based on maturity. Working with the practice leader, it is to be a community builder that can raise the level of every market to the highest standards. It is an innovator’s role that looks at new technologies, platforms and experience to push the capabilities of what is possible. While technical strength is important, imagination and innovation are critical to help our clients deliver delightful experiences. Drive the Growth Markets Adobe Content and Commerce Practice that includes: Content Management build operate and run for multiple environments and experiences. Commerce platform that integrates with multiple technologies and is part of a total omnichannel go to market. Content operations including brands as publishers and synthetic photography. Forms design, development and scaling as part of broader eco-systems and integration platforms including workflow and e-signatures. Work closely with the Communications and Design capabilities to ensure deals and deliveries are about end experiences and not just the technology. Optimise the processes, operating procedures and development programs that will allow the practice to scale including the creation of development studios and resources from multiple parts of Accenture. Help solution and architect all large and complex deals, while being the SME and leading the pitch for the technology solution. Create assets that can be used to position and originate opportunities for the practices’ offerings (to different parts of Accenture and to clients) Desired Experience: At least 5 years in the digital technology space with an understanding of digital marketing, digital advertising and customer experience. Worked in teams that have delivered work that has delivered complex pitches and projects in content and commerce platforms. Worked on multiple channels and technologies beyond websites and pushed the boundaries to new experiences such as chat, voice, AR/VR. Solution architected and pitched complex, multi-platform solutions to technical and non-technical audiences. Played an SME or supporting role for colleagues in both sales and delivery in multiple geographies. Hands on knowledge of the Adobe Experience Cloud stack (and ideally it’s competitors). A successful applicant will be: Curious problem solver, especially in technology, content, commerce and customer experiences. Explainer and simplifier – able to make the complex understandable. Up to date with the latest technologies and channels, including experimenting with the Metaverse. Adaptable to multiple cultures – working with people in different roles around the world. Empathetic with genuine interest in the client outcomes and the best interest of the team. We Are: Accenture Song accelerates growth and value for our clients through sustained customer relevance. Our capabilities span ideation to execution: growth, product and experience design; technology and experience platforms; creative, media and marketing strategy; and campaign, content and channel orchestration. With strong client relationships and deep industry expertise, we help our clients operate at the speed of life through the unlimited potential of imagination, technology and intelligence. Visit us at: www.accenture.com/song We Look For: If you are an expert at developing business, we want to meet you. If you relish delivering business, we want to meet you! If you love innovating and building industry leading digital solutions, we want to meet you!! There is never a typical day at Accenture Song, that’s why people love it here. The opportunities to make a difference while working on exciting client initiatives are limitless in this ever-changing space. Your role will require you to directly work with the client to bring ideas and innovation for customer relationships, digital marketing, ecommerce, and omni-channel solutions. You will also be accountable for helping to drive new ideas with the client and working with the practice specific teams to ensure client value and ability to execute are front and centre. About Accenture Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Interactive, Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com. At Accenture, our philosophy is anchored in recognising that our people are multi-dimensional. We take an intersectional human approach to create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day. We believe that equality drives innovation. Our commitment to accelerating equality starts at the top with our board and CEO and extends across every part of the company. This comes to life when our people own the equality agenda, making it part of their jobs – every decision, every day – and feel free to speak up and to act. We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences, such as age, ability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion, or sexual orientation. We want a workplace that is inclusive and diverse to that end we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs. Learn how Accenture protects your personal data and know your rights in relation to your personal data. Read more about our Privacy Statement. ')
(796, ' 795 --> Digital Identity Architect & Consultant (all genders) Accenture DACH Stuttgart, Baden-Wuerttemberg, Germany Decentralized/Blockchain Identity Technology, Self-Sovereign Identity as well as eIDAS & European DI Infrastructure are topics that match your skills? Then you are the perfect fit for Accenture: We are an international consulting and technology company, digital innovation center and forward-looking creative agency all in one. Our global team not only works to lay the foundations for the digital world of the future, but also develops digital identity solutions together with our customers that are used by all citizens. Our solutions form the basis for fully digital processes at citizen registration offices, right through to the identification and authentication of users in the metaverse. To this end, we work together with various public institutions as well as numerous customers from the economy. That awaits you You advise our national and international customers technically and professionally on digital identity solutions - also based on blockchain technology. Whether its an ID card, drivers license or certificate: you help to define and implement secure and, above all, user-friendly identity solutions. For this purpose, you also develop the technical solution design, including the architecture for the respective identity solutions (wallet apps and backend). With your accurate process analyzes you design processes for the exhibition as well as verification of digital identities. And in technical code reviews, you will work closely with our development teams, enriching them with clever suggestions and important insights. (844, ' 843 --> Studio Account Lead – Lighthouse Clients - Metaverse Continuum Business Group Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Studio Account Lead–Lighthouse Clients - Metaverse Continuum Business Group (ML5) Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves, and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in our Accenture Technology Vision 2022. The work The Studio Account Lead will be responsible for managing a team of creative, design, technical and strategy team members in defining strategy, establishing product/market fit, and test and learn product approaches for clients to discover and thrive in the metaverse. While there will never be a typical day in the Metaverse studio, we’ve highlighted a few of your exciting responsibilities. Interfaces with clients, senior Accenture management, cross functional internal teams to ensure projects are on target with objectives, budget, and schedule. Intercedes between client and team for issues related to changes in project scope, budget, or strategic creative direction Strategically align with client on studio discovery and work by managing - internal and external - stakeholders, assessing resources and approaches that and ensure strategic, creative, and technical represent the best fit the strategy of the client and Accenture Leading a team on an approach to illicit the right approaches, people, and tactics to explore metaverse opportunities through workshops, brainstorming sessions, concept ideation, design thinking, and organization alignment. Development, communicate and oversee test and learn plans for POCs, prototypes, and research. Collaborates across Accenture Song and Accenture to generate value creation opportunities for our clients which utilize Accenture’s unique set of integrated capabilities Consistent student of the metaverse, culture and consumer trends to identify opportunities and help keep clients and colleagues at the forefront of new developments What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant, and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing, and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 10 years’ experience in account management, account planning, advertising, communications, or marketing Minimum 10 years of experience design, product leadership, innovation or client-side experience managing complex relationships and delivering multi-channel experiences Bachelors degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience Bonus points if you have Product and experience innovation expertise that leads to the product going live in a massive way Experience with development, communication and overseeing test and learn plans Solid understanding of creative processes across virtual and physical channels Strong ability to understand insights and turn them into strategic plans Ability to inspire and lead teams by setting forth a vision for the account Ability to mentor and develop talent Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing, and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 10 years’ experience in account management, account planning, advertising, communications, or marketing Minimum 10 years of experience design, product leadership, innovation or client-side experience managing complex relationships and delivering multi-channel experiences Bachelors degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience Bonus points if you have Product and experience innovation expertise that leads to the product going live in a massive way Experience with development, communication and overseeing test and learn plans Solid understanding of creative processes across virtual and physical channels Strong ability to understand insights and turn them into strategic plans Ability to inspire and lead teams by setting forth a vision for the account Ability to mentor and develop talent Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. As an XR Architect, your missions will be: Accompany our clients in their digital transformation by shaping, directing and implementing technological solutions through multi-party systems (Blockchain, Tokenization, NFTs), and through extended reality (Augmented Reality, Virtual Reality and Mixed Reality); Lead the creation of new offers and assets or the evolution of existing offers and assets; Articulate and explain the technological vision and strategy to our clients in an international context; Design and provide solutions on complex technical projects: advise on architecture and assess risk elements; Support the development of Accentures Metaverse strategy. The XR Architect job is for you if: You have more than 7 years of experience in the development of professional software; You are familiar with Unity or Unreal Engine (or a similar engine); You have a good knowledge of building modern digital solutions and advanced XR elements (3D modeling, content pipelines, shaders, animation, real-time rendering...); You have significant experience as an architect and you master several programming languages. You will also stand out thanks to the following elements: You master all phases of a typical software development life cycle (SDLC), preferably with agile methods like Scrum, Kanban, SAFe; You have significant experience implementing emerging technologies at scale. As an XR Architect, you join our Technology experts to harness the power of digital, drive innovation and improve the lives of our customers. Combine business expertise and knowledge of cutting-edge technologies to help our clients reinvent their business, while strengthening their cyber-resilience. Accenture is a community of more than 600,000 talents and a common mission to realize the technological promise combined with human ingenuity. In a constantly changing world, we accelerate the transformation of the largest companies, from strategy to project implementation, using the technologies of tomorrow and boost their growth thanks to the multi-sector expertise of our experts! (800, ' 799 --> Lecturer in Visualisation Kings College London Campus, IL (Onsite) Job Description As part of its strategic development, the Department of Informatics is seeking applications from candidates for the position of Lecturer in Visualization for AI and Data Science, starting in January 2023, or as soon as possible thereafter. The successful applicant for this post is a computer scientist who will undertake research in the area of Visualization for AI and Data Science. They will be assigned to teach on modules on postgraduate and undergraduate degree programmes offered by the Department of Informatics, and will be expected to supervise both undergraduate and postgraduate projects. The Department seeks to broaden and deepen its current strengths in this area, so all candidates engaged in research and teaching that add to the expertise of the existing members of the Department will be considered favourably. Topics of interest in Visualization for AI and Data Science include, but are not limited to: human data interfaces and human AI interfaces (HDI and HAI), the Metaverse, Digital Twins, 3D graphics and advanced rendering, the application of interactive AR/VR hardware, psychophysics of human perception and cognition and interdisciplinary visualization methods including urban informatics visualization. The successful candidate will be given the opportunity to join the most relevant group, will be expected to contribute to the departmental hubs, and contribute to the Centre for Doctoral Training in Safe and Trusted Artificial Intelligence. Research collaboration across research groups, departmental hubs and with other Departments in the Faculty and across the College is strongly encouraged. Our staff and students come from all over the world, and the Department is proud of its friendly and inclusive culture. Diversity is positively encouraged with a number of family-friendly policies, including the operation of a core hours policy, the right to apply for flexible working and support for staff returning from periods of extended absence, for example maternity leave. The Department of Informatics is committed to ensuring an inclusive interview process and will reimburse up to £250 towards any additional care costs (for a dependent child or adult) incurred as a result of attending an interview for this position. Applicants must have a PhD in a relevant area, an excellent publication record, and the ability to attract research funding. It is essential that applicants have the enthusiasm and commitment required to contribute to the further development of the research standing of the Department of Informatics, and to make a full contribution to teaching and administrative activities. For further information about the Department of Informatics at King’s, please see https://nms.kcl.ac.uk/luc.moreau/informatics/overview.pdf. Key responsibilities The Successful Candidate Is Expected To engage in advanced research, maintain an outstanding track record of published research at a level of international excellence, and lead activities promoting research impact. make a significant contribution to the teaching, examining and project supervision of undergraduate and MSc students in the Department of Informatics. supervise research students in the Department of Informatics and act as personal tutor to students as agreed with the Head of Department, assist with difficulties, e.g. learning support/problems and be responsible for the pastoral care of students. undertake any other reasonable duties that may be requested by the Head of Department. The above list of responsibilities may not be exhaustive, and the post holder will be required to undertake such tasks and responsibilities as may reasonably be expected within the scope and grading of the post. Skills, Knowledge, And Experience Essential criteria PhD in computer science, artificial intelligence, visualisation or related field. Strong research record in computer science, artificial intelligence, and/or visualization as evidenced by publications in high quality journals and conferences; research experience and good reputation in relevant research field; potential to acquire research project funding; ability to supervise research students. Ability to teach undergraduate and postgraduate modules in computer science and/or artificial intelligence. Ability to make a significant contribution to administrative work. Desirable criteria Teaching and examining experience. Experience in attracting external research funds. Administrative experience. Further information The selection process will include a presentation and a panel interview. The candidates will also have the opportunity to meet members of the department. Interviews are scheduled to be held on 30 November 2022. Scheduling of presentations will be confirmed once shortlisting has taken place. Meetings, presentations and interviews are subject to pandemic constraints and may be held online. ')

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. (823, ' 822 --> Business Development Executive EduTech The Justified Talent Group Sydney, New South Wales, Australia iSee™ is an Australian video meeting solution that enables many-to-many crowd collaboration, merging video conferencing with interactive, virtual spaces. Participants video and audio is streamed in real time via personal webcams into an immersive setting where they can move around freely, form groups, talk and share content just as they would in the real world. The iSee technology enables large video meetings to take place using an order of magnitude less bandwidth, with a higher level of engagement, than existing video conferencing systems. This platform delivers rich stimulating experiences, immersive activity, community & culture. Its a compelling venue for team interaction, fostering the freedom to build strong relationships - to engage & discuss, debate & innovate - and to ultimately drive achievement online.
