(830, ' 829 --> IP Analyst (Hybrid/Remote) Utopia Music Helsinki, Uusimaa, Finland (Remote) WELCOME TO UTOPIA Music is incredible. It can excite hundreds, and unite thousands. But as an industry, it has been slow, complicated, and disparate. While the tech world has moved into the future, the music industry continues to be shaped by inefficient systems of the past. At Utopia we believe there is a better way. Which is why today we are setting out to transform the entire industry; creating new revenue streams, consolidating the data and decluttering the admin. Unlocking the industry’s full potential by unifying it all in one truly holistic space. Some might call that a Utopia. Funnily enough, so do we. Welcome to Utopia. Where music lives. What Utopians Do The open secret is that the music industry is struggling with the very basics of music accounting: What was played, when and where? Who should get paid and how much? Utopia Music is bridging the data gap by connecting global consumption, accurate metadata, and fast payments to an industry-wide trust platform. Our goal is to unlock creative value and enable Fair Pay For Every Play to make a better world for Music. The solutions we offer do not threaten to usurp the role of industry incumbents - it is about bringing transparency in the industry and supporting efficient royalty collection for all. THE ROLE As IP Analyst, you will work on the first line, advising on all matters relating to IP landscaping and provide regular IP reports to different business and functions. As a key member of the BA – Intellectual Property team you will be a corner stone in achieving Utopia’s objective to Gain the Trust of the Industry, and will collaborate closely with our Strategy and Business Units. You will be a key player, a strategic business partner providing IP searches and analysis to enable effective and informed decision making within Utopia Group. You will collaborate closely with our inventor’s community to develop a first class WW IP portfolio, and with our Business Analysts to provide insights on dynamic market changes within the competition and other insights that positively impact business decisions and strategy, by ensuring all competitive IP intelligence is available and easily accessible to key customers, partners and other stakeholders. Responsibilities In this position, you will be primarily accountable for consistently and effectively: Developing and delivering regular analysed IP data, insights and reports, including competitor IP landscapes, threat assessments, strength positioning, etc. Conducting IP landscape evaluations to identify trends in a technology field, deliver IP competitive intelligence, identify potential new research areas, licensing and acquisition opportunities Preparing search reports and IP landscaping analysis and share with key stakeholders adapting the content to the audience Acting in providing support to develop and maintain a first class World Wide IP Portfolio Provide technical research and analysis with respect to patentability, validity, freedom-to-operate, infringement, monitoring of the competitive landscape in different technological areas Prepare search strategies to identify relevant patent and scientific literature in a given technology domain, and subsequent analysis Identify and report innovations in a specific technology domain through analysis of patent, product, and academic literature Provide support in assisting inventors with invention disclosure forms, refining/pivoting inventions if/when needed Assisting Business Units with innovation capture Review and provide technical analysis related to patent applications search reports. Requirements At least 3 years in similar roles with competitive intelligence and IP search - with advanced degree required in Electrical/Data Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field Patent/IP Agent/Scientific /Business Analyst - experience in search and patent literature Experience with patent related databases and proven experience in the patent searcher field is preferable Technical background/knowledge in data and databases, signal processing, music industry, gaming industry, new technologies (blockchain, metaverse, Big Data management, etc.) Proficient in MS Office including Word, Excel and PowerPoint Fluent in English, additional languages are a plus! Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. (835, ' 834 --> IP Analyst (Hybrid/Remote) Utopia Music Stockholm City, Stockholm County, Sweden (Remote) WELCOME TO UTOPIA Music is incredible. It can excite hundreds, and unite thousands. But as an industry, it has been slow, complicated, and disparate. While the tech world has moved into the future, the music industry continues to be shaped by inefficient systems of the past. At Utopia we believe there is a better way. Which is why today we are setting out to transform the entire industry; creating new revenue streams, consolidating the data and decluttering the admin. Unlocking the industry’s full potential by unifying it all in one truly holistic space. Some might call that a Utopia. Funnily enough, so do we. Welcome to Utopia. Where music lives. What Utopians Do The open secret is that the music industry is struggling with the very basics of music accounting: What was played, when and where? Who should get paid and how much? Utopia Music is bridging the data gap by connecting global consumption, accurate metadata, and fast payments to an industry-wide trust platform. Our goal is to unlock creative value and enable Fair Pay For Every Play to make a better world for Music. The solutions we offer do not threaten to usurp the role of industry incumbents - it is about bringing transparency in the industry and supporting efficient royalty collection for all. THE ROLE As IP Analyst, you will work on the first line, advising on all matters relating to IP landscaping and provide regular IP reports to different business and functions. As a key member of the BA – Intellectual Property team you will be a corner stone in achieving Utopia’s objective to Gain the Trust of the Industry, and will collaborate closely with our Strategy and Business Units. You will be a key player, a strategic business partner providing IP searches and analysis to enable effective and informed decision making within Utopia Group. You will collaborate closely with our inventor’s community to develop a first class WW IP portfolio, and with our Business Analysts to provide insights on dynamic market changes within the competition and other insights that positively impact business decisions and strategy, by ensuring all competitive IP intelligence is available and easily accessible to key customers, partners and other stakeholders. Responsibilities In this position, you will be primarily accountable for consistently and effectively: Developing and delivering regular analysed IP data, insights and reports, including competitor IP landscapes, threat assessments, strength positioning, etc. Conducting IP landscape evaluations to identify trends in a technology field, deliver IP competitive intelligence, identify potential new research areas, licensing and acquisition opportunities Preparing search reports and IP landscaping analysis and share with key stakeholders adapting the content to the audience Acting in providing support to develop and maintain a first class World Wide IP Portfolio Provide technical research and analysis with respect to patentability, validity, freedom-to-operate, infringement, monitoring of the competitive landscape in different technological areas Prepare search strategies to identify relevant patent and scientific literature in a given technology domain, and subsequent analysis Identify and report innovations in a specific technology domain through analysis of patent, product, and academic literature Provide support in assisting inventors with invention disclosure forms, refining/pivoting inventions if/when needed Assisting Business Units with innovation capture Review and provide technical analysis related to patent applications search reports. Requirements At least 3 years in similar roles with competitive intelligence and IP search - with advanced degree required in Electrical/Data Engineering, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field Patent/IP Agent/Scientific /Business Analyst - experience in search and patent literature Experience with patent related databases and proven experience in the patent searcher field is preferable Technical background/knowledge in data and databases, signal processing, music industry, gaming industry, new technologies (blockchain, metaverse, Big Data management, etc.) Proficient in MS Office including Word, Excel and PowerPoint Fluent in English, additional languages are a plus! Experience leading actionable and cross-functional strategic workshops What We Offer Great atmosphere - we live, love & breathe music & tech! Working in an impact oriented team and inclusive company culture. An experienced team to learn from, with proven track records in multiple startups and big tech companies. Our flexible remote policy provides Utopians the freedom to work either from one of our inspiring offices or from home. We celebrate being an international and multicultural company. Competitive benefits; packages depend on location. You’ll be given more details on this during the interview process. We are recruiting across the following of our European locations for this role (UK, Sweden, Switzerland, Finland, Spain, Germany, Netherlands) and can therefore only move forward with applications from those already based in these locations and with eligibility to work in the country you are based in. THE HIRING PROCESS You send us your CV in English We invite you for an introductory video call with the Talent Acquisition team to get to know you better and share more about us We invite you for a video interview with our head of IP and Licensing We kindly ask that you complete a assignment at home to be presented and discussed during a final interview with the team UTOPIANS As we want to bring transparency, trust, and clarity to the music industry we serve, we know a change comes from within. Utopia is a transparent, trust-based organization striving to have clarity in thinking and doing what we set out to do. We execute urgently and innovate to grow faster. We ship things that make a difference today, so we can make them better tomorrow. We embrace fairness and are all accountable. Strictly diverse and inclusive. We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate our diverse backgrounds and we welcome everyone who identifies with the above to apply. Welcome to Utopia - Where Music Lives! We’re eager to meet You! :) Utopia Music is a Swiss Music fintech company leveling up the Music Industry through clear, transparent, and reliable data-based solutions. We support the whole Industry to make more money, faster, with less costs, and less errors. In Utopia, the Industry sees market opportunities live. Investors elevate Music catalogs into a real asset class. Collection societies track more and spend less. Labels, publishers, and distributors simplify and enhance their business. And everyone gets Fair Pay for Every Play. Utopia is serving the music copyrights and the industry from creation to consumption, and will never compete against it. It means that we will never own copyrights. We will never be owned by the major stakeholders of the industry. We will never share or sell data of our customers to anyone else. ')

Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. (840, ' 839 --> Studio Account Lead – Lighthouse Clients - Metaverse Continuum Business Group Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Studio Account Lead–Lighthouse Clients - Metaverse Continuum Business Group (ML5) Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves, and the world. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. The work The Studio Account Lead will be responsible for managing a team of creative, design, technical and strategy team members in defining strategy, establishing product/market fit, and test and learn product approaches for clients to discover and thrive in the metaverse. While there will never be a typical day in the Metaverse studio, we’ve highlighted a few of your exciting responsibilities. Interfaces with clients, senior Accenture management, cross functional internal teams to ensure projects are on target with objectives, budget, and schedule. Intercedes between client and team for issues related to changes in project scope, budget, or strategic creative direction Strategically align with client on studio discovery and work by managing - internal and external - stakeholders, assessing resources and approaches that and ensure strategic, creative, and technical represent the best fit the strategy of the client and Accenture Leading a team on an approach to illicit the right approaches, people, and tactics to explore metaverse opportunities through workshops, brainstorming sessions, concept ideation, design thinking, and organization alignment. Development, communicate and oversee test and learn plans for POCs, prototypes, and research. Collaborates across Accenture Song and Accenture to generate value creation opportunities for our clients which utilize Accenture’s unique set of integrated capabilities Consistent student of the metaverse, culture and consumer trends to identify opportunities and help keep clients and colleagues at the forefront of new developments What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant, and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing, and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. The role will involve understanding and anticipating the needs of a variety of different game projects and coordinating the development of the technologies to support and grow a rich and complex infrastructure. Requirements At least 10+ years of experience in game development technology - Shipped at least 3 high-quality large-scale multiplayer games in a capacity as a lead programmer or technical director. - Deep understanding of back end technology stacks including database (SQL &NoSQL), web services (micro and monolithic), containerization, CDN, scalability, versioning, security, CI/CD, serverless, cloud platforms, languages (Nodejs, C#, Go, Python, Java) - Deep knowledge of game front end languages (C++, C#), methodologies and libraries, multiple game engines (Unity, Unreal, etc) - Strong commitment to clean code structure, avoiding tech debt, “rightsizing” code scope (neither under- nor over-engineered) - Familiarity with blockchain gaming and related technologies To Hear More About This Role You Can email - neil@cryptorecruit.com Cryptorecruit are the worlds leading specialist recruiter for the blockchain/Cryptocurrency industry. (856, ' 855 --> Transformation Consultant Lenovo Bratislava, Bratislava, Slovakia Description And Requirements Lenovo is seeking an experienced Transformation Consultant who will develop comprehensive, creative, and cost-effective services and solutions for our customers to help transform and modernize their environment. Your role will be to evaluate customer opportunities as presented in, RFPs/RFQs or engagements, from the Services Sales teams and use this information to develop solutions to meet customer’s requirements. Lenovo solutions may incorporate one or more lifecycle services including Device as a Service (DaaS), Managed Services, Digital Workplace Services, and any additional endpoint lifecycle/management services. Your Responsibilities will be to: Provide endpoint management and lifecycle and information technology expertise Travel to and facilitate workshops with customers to analyze customer processes and environments and develop overall solution recommendations, including total cost of ownership assessments. Partner across multiple organizations including, but not limited to, sales; finance; service delivery; customers and business partners and contribute to all elements of the services sales cycle from the project kickoff; stakeholder coordination and end solution strategy. Contribute to customer presentations and briefings, provide input during deal qualification reviews, and prepare content for solution reviews with key stakeholders as required. Collaborate with Solution Architects for the development of a SOW contract with both the selected business partner and the customer. Promote, sell, manage pipeline and contribute to the overall business management systems within the services group. Ancillary responsibilities will include contributing to the ongoing education of our sales force through consistent and frequent interactions as well as contributing content and customer feedback to the worldwide Lenovo Services portfolio group Position Requirements: 7+ years of Contract Management, SOW’s, Business Development, Professional Services, Project Management and/or IT Services operations experience. Direct experience in IT Services Industry focused on the PC Lifecycle or have an understanding of typical IT client infrastructures, tools and associated endpoint lifecycle/management activities and have the ability to generate and communicate associated services value propositions. Familiarity with and understanding of endpoint device management solutions and industry best practices Proven success in building solutions in the IT services industry A strategic mindset and sound business acumen are required, along with effective decision-making, contract negotiation and partner management skills Excellent communication, both oral and written, and polished presentation skills Proven ability to operate with a high level of professionalism; entrepreneurialism and agility Travel estimated at 40% Additional Preferred Qualifications Technical certification from Microsoft, Virtualization tools, endpoint management tools and ITIL Global Account or Global Enterprise Account Sales experience with multiple stakeholder buy-in You will report to SSG (Solutions & Services Group) organization structure. SSG has been focusing on the expanding IT service market, especially the digital workplace services opportunity, the growing demand for aaS (as-a-Service) model, and customers’ stronger preference for sustainability services. Meanwhile, SSG continued to invest in software tools, platforms, and repeatable vertical solutions with our own IP, and focus on vertical solutions in manufacturing, retail, healthcare, education, and Smart City. We are expanding TruScale as-a-Service to Digital Workplace solutions, developing our Hybrid Cloud solutions, and exploring Metaverse solutions. What Lenovo can offer you: Opportunities for career development & growth Access to various training Performance-based rewards Flexible working environment (combination of working from home/office) We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class. (857, ' 856 --> Studio Account Lead – Lighthouse Clients - Metaverse Continuum Business Group Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Studio Account Lead–Lighthouse Clients - Metaverse Continuum Business Group (ML5) Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves, and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in our Accenture Technology Vision 2022. The work The Studio Account Lead will be responsible for managing a team of creative, design, technical and strategy team members in defining strategy, establishing product/market fit, and test and learn product approaches for clients to discover and thrive in the metaverse. While there will never be a typical day in the Metaverse studio, we’ve highlighted a few of your exciting responsibilities. Interfaces with clients, senior Accenture management, cross functional internal teams to ensure projects are on target with objectives, budget, and schedule. Intercedes between client and team for issues related to changes in project scope, budget, or strategic creative direction Strategically align with client on studio discovery and work by managing - internal and external - stakeholders, assessing resources and approaches that and ensure strategic, creative, and technical represent the best fit the strategy of the client and Accenture Leading a team on an approach to illicit the right approaches, people, and tactics to explore metaverse opportunities through workshops, brainstorming sessions, concept ideation, design thinking, and organization alignment. Development, communicate and oversee test and learn plans for POCs, prototypes, and research. Collaborates across Accenture Song and Accenture to generate value creation opportunities for our clients which utilize Accenture’s unique set of integrated capabilities Consistent student of the metaverse, culture and consumer trends to identify opportunities and help keep clients and colleagues at the forefront of new developments What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant, and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. Youll be joining our diverse team of metaverse-skilled professionals with market-leading capabilities dedicated to designing, executing, and accelerating our clients’ metaverse journeys. The time is now to think big, start small and scale fast. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 10 years’ experience in account management, account planning, advertising, communications, or marketing Minimum 10 years of experience design, product leadership, innovation or client-side experience managing complex relationships and delivering multi-channel experiences Bachelors degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience Bonus points if you have Product and experience innovation expertise that leads to the product going live in a massive way Experience with development, communication and overseeing test and learn plans Solid understanding of creative processes across virtual and physical channels Strong ability to understand insights and turn them into strategic plans Ability to inspire and lead teams by setting forth a vision for the account Ability to mentor and develop talent Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. (858, ' 857 --> Senior Director, Digital and Innovation - Head of Metaverse KPMG Canada St. Catharines, ON (On-site) Insight At KPMG, you will be part of a diverse and dedicated team of problem-solving professionals with a common goal of translating information into opportunity for our clients and communities around the world. Job Summary At KPMG, we believe extended reality is a new frontier that harnesses converging technologies to shape the virtual universe of the future – an immersive, interconnected 3D world in which virtual reality, augmented reality, artificial intelligence, blockchain and cryptocurrencies will redefine the way we live, work and socialize. This is an exceptional opportunity to join the rapidly growing KPMG Content Creation team in Canada to help our clients navigate this new digital frontier known as the metaverse. We are looking for passionate pioneers to help our customers drive lasting value in this emerging virtual reality network that will transform commerce, customer experience and communities. KPMGs Content Creation team is made up of innovative designers who work together to leverage cutting-edge technologies to create new ways of working and interacting in the multi-industry digital world. what you will do Reporting directly to the Managing Partner and President, Digital and Innovation, the incumbent works closely with the Leader, Cryptoassets and Blockchain, Leader, Customer Experience, and other cross-functional teams using different virtual platforms to help our customers to carry out their projects in the metaverse. This includes informing clients, preparing proposals, creating engaging content on the metaverse, and sharing successful experiences on various platforms. He uses his experience and storytelling skills to simplify for senior leaders some of the more complex aspects of the metaverse and Web3 and propose strategies that will drive the success of current and future organizational initiatives. Successful candidates have a genuine passion for Metaverse, Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), Decentralized Finance and Web3, combined with in-depth knowledge of institutional industry practices. Although your activities will vary each day, here are the main tasks you will be required to perform as part of your duties Define and lead the go-to-market strategy in collaboration with the Metavers working group. Lead the development of high-impact, visually appealing proposals that present thought-provoking ideas, engage clients and deliver added value. Advise clients on metaverse implementation strategies, including establishing and prioritizing relevant use cases, and experience design. Organize stimulating training workshops and demonstrations of virtual platforms used in various sectors of activity. Establish and maintain strategic collaborations with external organizations to identify concrete opportunities in this area. Design digital events and business activities in the metaverse for our teams, clients and communities; plan, design, facilitate and oversee the delivery of such experiences. Research and develop content that informs and demonstrates our foresight and thought leadership, both internally and externally. What you bring to the role Passion for the metaverse, augmented reality/virtual reality (AR/VR) experiences and the underlying technology infrastructure. Active presence on several virtual platforms (Decentraland, The Sandbox, Horizon Worlds, Engage, Altspaces, etc.). Basic knowledge of the processes, tools and building blocks of Extended Reality (AR/VR), Metaverse, NFTs, Token Economy System and Cryptocurrency Wallets. Good understanding of emerging trends and use cases in the web3 and metaverse space. At least five years of experience in commercial technology development. Experience building, launching, sustaining and growing online communities and initiatives to drive community engagement. Strong communication and collaboration skills, and the ability to speak at both a technical and a strategic level. Ability to lead multiple workflows and multiple assignments simultaneously. Experience in facilitation, storytelling and client presentations. The keys to your success KPMG staff members act effectively | promote growth | inspire trust and understand that a diverse workforce allows us to deepen our relationships and enrich the firm. Were here to support you so you can perform at your best. To learn more about KPMG benefits and well-being in Canada, click here. Our values, the KPMG way Integrity, we do what is right | Excellency, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For the better, we make our work count KPMG in Canada proudly subscribes to the principle of equal employment opportunity and is committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free work environment, thereby enabling all members of its staff to achieve their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in our mission to bring you to the workplace. We invite all qualified candidates to come forward and we hope you will make KPMG in Canada your employer of choice. For more information on Inclusion, Diversity and Equity in Recruitment, click here. For general recruiting questions, contact the HR Delivery Center at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca. Here’s What You’ll Need Minimum 10 years’ experience in account management, account planning, advertising, communications, or marketing Minimum 10 years of experience design, product leadership, innovation or client-side experience managing complex relationships and delivering multi-channel experiences Bachelors degree or equivalent (minimum 12 years) work experience Bonus points if you have Product and experience innovation expertise that leads to the product going live in a massive way Experience with development, communication and overseeing test and learn plans Solid understanding of creative processes across virtual and physical channels Strong ability to understand insights and turn them into strategic plans Ability to inspire and lead teams by setting forth a vision for the account Ability to mentor and develop talent Travel For now, all Accenture business travel, international and domestic, is currently restricted to client-essential sales/delivery activity only. Please note: The safety and well-being of our people continues to be the top priority, and our decisions around travel are informed by government COVID-19 response directives, recommendations from leading health authorities and guidance from a number of infectious disease experts. As required by the\u202fColorado Equal Pay Transparency Act, Accenture provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Colorado. Actual compensation is influenced by a wide array of factors including but not limited to skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. For the state of Colorado only, the range of starting pay for this role is $110,376 - $235,200 and information on benefits offered. COVID-19 update: The safety and well-being of our candidates, our people and their families continues to be a top priority. Until travel restrictions change, interviews will continue to be conducted virtually. Subject to applicable law, please be aware that Accenture requires all employees to be fully vaccinated as a condition of employment. Accenture will consider requests for accommodation to this vaccination requirement during the recruiting process. What We Believe We have an unwavering commitment to diversity with the aim that every one of our people has a full sense of belonging within our organization. As a business imperative, every person at Accenture has the responsibility to create and sustain an inclusive environment. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and more creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Read more here Equal Employment Opportunity Statement Accenture is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We believe that no one should be discriminated against because of their differences, such as age, disability, ethnicity, gender, gender identity and expression, religion or sexual orientation. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law. Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. For details, view a copy of the Accenture Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Policy Statement. Requesting An Accommodation Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, including reasonable accommodation when needed. If you are hired by Accenture and require accommodation to perform the essential functions of your role, you will be asked to participate in our reasonable accommodation process. Accommodations made to facilitate the recruiting process are not a guarantee of future or continued accommodations once hired. If you would like to be considered for employment opportunities with Accenture and have accommodation needs for a disability or religious observance, please call us toll free at 1 (877) 889-9009, send us an email or speak with your recruiter. Other Employment Statements Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States. Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration. Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process. The Company will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. Additionally, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the Companys legal duty to furnish information. ')
(862, ' 861 --> Studio Account Lead – Lighthouse Clients - Metaverse Continuum Business Group Accenture Albany, New York Metropolitan Area Studio Account Lead–Lighthouse Clients - Metaverse Continuum Business Group (ML5) Who We Are As part of Accenture’s Metaverse Continuum Business Group, were helping redefine what is possible for our clients, ourselves, and the world. Our vision is one that is built on human experience—and we see the Metaverse as a continuum, a spectrum of digitally enhanced worlds, realities, and business models. Its a new medium for commerce, experience and community and we’re looking for pioneers driven to help us bring our vision to life responsibly, generating sustainable and diverse value in the short and long term. Were a passionate global group of business strategists, creatives, architects, engineers, innovators, and entrepreneurs—and we work with pioneering ecosystem partners, forward-thinking regulators and industry influencers who are collectively ushering in the next evolution of how we engage and interact with the world. Learn more about the trends we see shaping businesses and industries in our Accenture Technology Vision 2022. The work The Studio Account Lead will be responsible for managing a team of creative, design, technical and strategy team members in defining strategy, establishing product/market fit, and test and learn product approaches for clients to discover and thrive in the metaverse. While there will never be a typical day in the Metaverse studio, we’ve highlighted a few of your exciting responsibilities. Interfaces with clients, senior Accenture management, cross functional internal teams to ensure projects are on target with objectives, budget, and schedule. Intercedes between client and team for issues related to changes in project scope, budget, or strategic creative direction Strategically align with client on studio discovery and work by managing - internal and external - stakeholders, assessing resources and approaches that and ensure strategic, creative, and technical represent the best fit the strategy of the client and Accenture Leading a team on an approach to illicit the right approaches, people, and tactics to explore metaverse opportunities through workshops, brainstorming sessions, concept ideation, design thinking, and organization alignment. Development, communicate and oversee test and learn plans for POCs, prototypes, and research. Collaborates across Accenture Song and Accenture to generate value creation opportunities for our clients which utilize Accenture’s unique set of integrated capabilities Consistent student of the metaverse, culture and consumer trends to identify opportunities and help keep clients and colleagues at the forefront of new developments What’s in it for you? By joining our team, youll become part of a diverse, vibrant, and global Accenture community—one that is continually pushing boundaries in responsible and sustainable ways. Youll work on meaningful and innovative projects that radically change the way our clients view what is possible, while engaging in transformational initiatives powered by the latest Metaverse technologies. Youll have ongoing support in your learning and growth, with Accenture investing in opportunities for you to research, understand, and eventually help define the Metaverse as it continues to evolve and take shape. (863, ' 862 --> Senior Director, Digital and Innovation - Head of Metaverse KPMG Canada Lethbridge, AB (On-site) Insight At KPMG, you will be part of a diverse and dedicated team of problem-solving professionals with a common goal of translating information into opportunity for our clients and communities around the world. Job Summary At KPMG, we believe extended reality is a new frontier that harnesses converging technologies to shape the virtual universe of the future – an immersive, interconnected 3D world in which virtual reality, augmented reality, artificial intelligence, blockchain and cryptocurrencies will redefine the way we live, work and socialize. This is an exceptional opportunity to join the rapidly growing KPMG Content Creation team in Canada to help our clients navigate this new digital frontier known as the metaverse. We are looking for passionate pioneers to help our customers drive lasting value in this emerging virtual reality network that will transform commerce, customer experience and communities. KPMGs Content Creation team is made up of innovative designers who work together to leverage cutting-edge technologies to create new ways of working and interacting in the multi-industry digital world. what you will do Reporting directly to the Managing Partner and President, Digital and Innovation, the incumbent works closely with the Leader, Cryptoassets and Blockchain, Leader, Customer Experience, and other cross-functional teams using different virtual platforms to help our customers to carry out their projects in the metaverse. This includes informing clients, preparing proposals, creating engaging content on the metaverse, and sharing successful experiences on various platforms. He uses his experience and storytelling skills to simplify for senior leaders some of the more complex aspects of the metaverse and Web3 and propose strategies that will drive the success of current and future organizational initiatives. Successful candidates have a genuine passion for Metaverse, Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), Decentralized Finance and Web3, combined with in-depth knowledge of institutional industry practices. Although your activities will vary each day, here are the main tasks you will be required to perform as part of your duties Define and lead the go-to-market strategy in collaboration with the Metavers working group. Lead the development of high-impact, visually appealing proposals that present thought-provoking ideas, engage clients and deliver added value. Advise clients on metaverse implementation strategies, including establishing and prioritizing relevant use cases, and experience design. Organize stimulating training workshops and demonstrations of virtual platforms used in various sectors of activity. Establish and maintain strategic collaborations with external organizations to identify concrete opportunities in this area. Design digital events and business activities in the metaverse for our teams, clients and communities; plan, design, facilitate and oversee the delivery of such experiences. Research and develop content that informs and demonstrates our foresight and thought leadership, both internally and externally. What you bring to the role Passion for the metaverse, augmented reality/virtual reality (AR/VR) experiences and the underlying technology infrastructure. Active presence on several virtual platforms (Decentraland, The Sandbox, Horizon Worlds, Engage, Altspaces, etc.). Basic knowledge of the processes, tools and building blocks of Extended Reality (AR/VR), Metaverse, NFTs, Token Economy System and Cryptocurrency Wallets. Good understanding of emerging trends and use cases in the web3 and metaverse space. At least five years of experience in commercial technology development. Experience building, launching, sustaining and growing online communities and initiatives to drive community engagement. Strong communication and collaboration skills, and the ability to speak at both a technical and a strategic level. Ability to lead multiple workflows and multiple assignments simultaneously. Experience in facilitation, storytelling and client presentations. The keys to your success KPMG staff members act effectively | promote growth | inspire trust and understand that a diverse workforce allows us to deepen our relationships and enrich the firm. Were here to support you so you can perform at your best. To learn more about KPMG benefits and well-being in Canada, click here. Our values, the KPMG way Integrity, we do what is right | Excellency, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For the better, we make our work count KPMG in Canada proudly subscribes to the principle of equal employment opportunity and is committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free work environment, thereby enabling all members of its staff to achieve their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in our mission to bring you to the workplace. We invite all qualified candidates to come forward and we hope you will make KPMG in Canada your employer of choice. For more information on Inclusion, Diversity and Equity in Recruitment, click here. For general recruiting questions, contact the HR Delivery Center at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca. There are countless tools and features in our editor that can open up entire markets for our users. For this reason, it is of central importance that you actively accompany our community and understand where improvements are needed. You will work in close collaboration with our users on our Dear ImGui based Wonderland Editor, running on Windows, MacOS and Debian, to design efficient workflows and tools. Contribute to helping our community build bigger and more groundbreaking applications from release to release, and help Wonderland Engine become the development platform for WebXR. What We Offer Salaries in line with the market. Maximum flexibility: you decide if you prefer to work from home or in one of our offices in Paris or Cologne. Team meetings and events in VR. Monthly "Wonderland Engine Project Day", where each employee spends a day working on their own projects with Wonderland Engine. Your profile Advanced Git A fox Clean commit messages CMake C++ sanity Understand why STL/Boost are not suitable for our use case Understand how #include can affect compile times Basic performance sanity Solid handling of copies, moves and pass-by-reference Basic intuition tight loops, cache coherency and memory reads How to apply Apply directly via the form on this site or send your CV with cover letter to the email address: jobs@wonderlandengine.com. We will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at soeren.syrbe@wonderlandengine.com The web is the future for VR and AR. Wonderland Engine is the matching developer platform. Our product is the Wonderland Engine, a developer platform for VR, AR and 3D applications on the web. Applications developed with the Wonderland Engine run through a web browser and dont need to be installed on the respective target device first (e.g. the VR glasses). This makes development much faster. The applications can also be published directly via a web server without having to wait for confirmation from an app store. Development speed is the decisive factor in realizing the potential of VR and AR. For this reason, we are convinced that web-based applications will play a crucial role in the future of the Internet. Our goal is to become the worlds leading developer platform for web-based VR, AR and 3D applications. ')

You can respect the legacy of over 30 years of Sonic the Hedgehog video games, and work to preserve the integrity of the character across the projects you manage. In the SEGA Production Department, you will spend your days doing the following Gathering and digesting information about your project to reassess the current status of the project needs and priorities. Staying current on the requirements, restrictions, and special needs that a worldwide mobile title needs to continue service. Acting as the international product owner, making sure everyone understands the vision and nature of the product in your care. Communicating with the Development team in the UK to support their needs for the project and keeping up to date with the status of development. Communicating in written and verbal Japanese with the internal teams to make sure content approvals, publishing needs, and product setup and submission are all happening in a timely manner. Building resourcing plans and schedules for approval by your managers and alignment with your dev teams. Communicating with external vendors to estimate, schedule and execute on time, on quality and on budget for any production needs the title requires. Breaking down your projects into manageable subtasks and getting them done independently. Supporting the greater needs of the project, including coordinating internal communications, translating and distributing documentation, getting game text translated, or shuffling bug reports. Whatever it takes to get things done. Overseeing the recording of English voiceover with the legacy Studio, Director and Voice Talent. Coordinating with QA to make sure the quality of the product is assured, vetting issues, and providing direction to the Development team if necessary. Providing proactive guidance and engaging with marketing on external activities related to your product. Keeping the schedules accurate, up-to-date, and communicated outwardly regularly. Making sure people understand what makes your game fun, compelling, interesting, and unique, and what is the importance of the title to the brand roadmap. Building post-mortem lookbacks on your project for the benefit of yourself and the group. Playing the games and generating feedback and insight as needed. Staying aware of what metaverse needs and restrictions need to be actioned on to stay successful and relevant. Making sure best practices and policy is followed and implemented within your projects. Getting in front of fans and media to talk about and promote your product at tradeshows and media tours. Other duties as assigned. Once this pandemic is over, we may need to send you places! Fly both domestically and internationally 3 or 4 times a year. Occasionally visit and conduct business in Irvine, the UK, or Tokyo, Japan as required. * Passport and ability to enter the UK and Japan is required. Attend media, trade and consumer events a couple times a year. ')

(894, ' 893 --> Phd candidate in the area of XR & WEB3.0 Technologies (f/m/d) BMW Group Munich, Bavaria, Germany (On-site) THE FUTURE IS WHAT WE CREATE WHEN WE TAKE OUR VISIONS TO THE LIMITS. PHD AT THE BMW GROUP. Bridging the gap between your doctoral studies and the kind of career challenge you’re looking for isn’t always easy. That’s why our ProMotion PhD programme gives you the opportunity to apply your passion and scientific expertise to very real challenges that could shape the future of mobility. If selected, you’ll have the chance to really develop your own future career path with us through your practice-related thesis, promote your chosen specialty from within – and position yourself to secure the career you’ve always wanted. We, the BMW Group, offer you an interesting PhD program in the area of XR & WEB3.0 Technologies. As part of your PhD, you will analyze the integration between digital worlds and their influence on our physical world. Your focus will be on the conception, development, and analysis of new digital worlds, helping to shape the metaverse. As such, you will deal with essential metaverse technologies in the digital space, such as VR/AR/XR and even less explored WEB3.0 technologies, such as blockchain and non-fungible tokens. The aim of your PhD is to examine technological as well as business and ecosystem aspects of the metaverse. Furthermore, you will be able to evaluate your research within real-world use cases. During your PhD you will have the opportunity to work with a highly motivated team of international researchers and developers. In addition, you have the opportunity to spend time in one of our tech offices in the USA, China or Singapore. What awaits you? You combine theory and practice, making it possible to harness the potential of the metaverse for the BMW Group. You design, implement and evaluate automotive metaverse use cases. You get access to state-of-the-art IT and Metaverse hardware. You will work in an interdisciplinary, intercultural and highly qualified team with locations in the USA, Singapore and China. Will have a access to a strong network of scientists and the opportunity to mentor students. What should you bring along? You successfully completed a degree in computer science, media informatics, 3D design, or other related degrees. You have good basic programming skills, for example in Python, Javascript or C++ or other programming languages. You have already experience with Virtual Reality or Augmented Reality and/or with Web 3.0 and Blockchain technologies, such as NFTs. You have experience in the field of human-computer interaction and information visualization as well as the associated research methods. Nice to have: Experience in 3D real-time streaming (GPU Server, Web GL, Web AR, Web VR, three.js). Experience with WEB3.0 technologies such as Solidity and Smart Contracts standards (ERC20, 721). (917, ' 916 --> Senior Director, Digital and Innovation - Head of Metaverse KPMG Canada Saskatoon, SK (On-site) Insight At KPMG, you will be part of a diverse and dedicated team of problem-solving professionals with a common goal of translating information into opportunity for our clients and communities around the world. Job Summary At KPMG, we believe extended reality is a new frontier that harnesses converging technologies to shape the virtual universe of the future – an immersive, interconnected 3D world in which virtual reality, augmented reality, artificial intelligence, blockchain and cryptocurrencies will redefine the way we live, work and socialize. This is an exceptional opportunity to join the rapidly growing KPMG Content Creation team in Canada to help our clients navigate this new digital frontier known as the metaverse. We are looking for passionate pioneers to help our customers drive lasting value in this emerging virtual reality network that will transform commerce, customer experience and communities. KPMGs Content Creation team is made up of innovative designers who work together to leverage cutting-edge technologies to create new ways of working and interacting in the multi-industry digital world. what you will do Reporting directly to the Managing Partner and President, Digital and Innovation, the incumbent works closely with the Leader, Cryptoassets and Blockchain, Leader, Customer Experience, and other cross-functional teams using different virtual platforms to help our customers to carry out their projects in the metaverse. This includes informing clients, preparing proposals, creating engaging content on the metaverse, and sharing successful experiences on various platforms. He uses his experience and storytelling skills to simplify for senior leaders some of the more complex aspects of the metaverse and Web3 and propose strategies that will drive the success of current and future organizational initiatives. Successful candidates have a genuine passion for Metaverse, Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs), Decentralized Finance and Web3, combined with in-depth knowledge of institutional industry practices. Although your activities will vary each day, here are the main tasks you will be required to perform as part of your duties Define and lead the go-to-market strategy in collaboration with the Metavers working group. Lead the development of high-impact, visually appealing proposals that present thought-provoking ideas, engage clients and deliver added value. Advise clients on metaverse implementation strategies, including establishing and prioritizing relevant use cases, and experience design. Organize stimulating training workshops and demonstrations of virtual platforms used in various sectors of activity. Establish and maintain strategic collaborations with external organizations to identify concrete opportunities in this area. Design digital events and business activities in the metaverse for our teams, clients and communities; plan, design, facilitate and oversee the delivery of such experiences. Research and develop content that informs and demonstrates our foresight and thought leadership, both internally and externally. What you bring to the role Passion for the metaverse, augmented reality/virtual reality (AR/VR) experiences and the underlying technology infrastructure. Active presence on several virtual platforms (Decentraland, The Sandbox, Horizon Worlds, Engage, Altspaces, etc.). Basic knowledge of the processes, tools and building blocks of Extended Reality (AR/VR), Metaverse, NFTs, Token Economy System and Cryptocurrency Wallets. Good understanding of emerging trends and use cases in the web3 and metaverse space. At least five years of experience in commercial technology development. Experience building, launching, sustaining and growing online communities and initiatives to drive community engagement. Strong communication and collaboration skills, and the ability to speak at both a technical and a strategic level. Ability to lead multiple workflows and multiple assignments simultaneously. Experience in facilitation, storytelling and client presentations. The keys to your success KPMG staff members act effectively | promote growth | inspire trust and understand that a diverse workforce allows us to deepen our relationships and enrich the firm. Were here to support you so you can perform at your best. To learn more about KPMG benefits and well-being in Canada, click here. Our values, the KPMG way Integrity, we do what is right | Excellency, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For the better, we make our work count KPMG in Canada proudly subscribes to the principle of equal employment opportunity and is committed to providing a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free work environment, thereby enabling all members of its staff to achieve their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in our mission to bring you to the workplace. We invite all qualified candidates to come forward and we hope you will make KPMG in Canada your employer of choice. For more information on Inclusion, Diversity and Equity in Recruitment, click here. For general recruiting questions, contact the HR Delivery Center at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca. If you have questions about accessibility to employment at KPMG or would like to start a confidential conversation about your personal accessibility needs and accommodations during the recruitment process, we encourage you contact our Employee Relations Department by email at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or by phone at 416-777-8002 or toll-free at 1-888-466-4778. ')

(921, ' 920 --> Portfolio Manager - Digital Workplace Automation & Lifecycle Solutions Lenovo Renfrew, Scotland, United Kingdom Description And Requirements The Lenovo Services and Solutions Group is experiencing tremendous growth and is hiring for Worldwide Digital Workplace Automation and Life Cycle Solutions Portfolio Manager. You will be responsible for defining and delivering the full Digital Workplace Automation and Life Cycle Solutions & Managed Services portfolio required including short-term and long-term visions You will work with strategy, product managers, sales, customers, analysts, hardware teams, delivery, and other stakeholders to understand the Digital Workplace Automation and Life Cycle Solutions market and will define the needed portfolio of Managed Services required to succeed as the best in class in the digital workspace automation and productivity market. You should have a strong background in Digital Workplace Automation & Life Cycle Solutions and prior portfolio and/or product management experience. You will also need to have a background in Managed Services and a strong understanding of how to succeed in selling both direct and through the channel. Success will require the ability to influence and maintain open communication with all areas of the company at multiple levels. You should be able to manage complexity, think creatively, deal with ambiguity, and thrive in a fast-paced environment. Your Key Responsibilities will be: Utilize market intelligence, competitive analytics, sales feedback and customer feedback to formulate both a short-term and long-term Digital Workplace Automation and Life Cycle Solutions portfolio strategy that will drive Lenovo to be the industry leader in Digital Workplace Managed Services Assess future technology for usage in Digital Workplace Automation and Life Cycle services portfolio to differentiate Lenovo Managed Services and drive it to the forefront of the industry Rationalize the current Digital Workplace Automation and Life Cycle portfolio, identify gaps/overlaps and make recommendations on the future of all existing products Prioritize offering development and create roadmaps for driving to a complete portfolio vision – may include bundling existing products into solutions as part of the portfolio Create clear portfolio vision that can be utilized by marketing to create sales and customer-facing documentation Function as the input for strategic and offering ideas coming from the geography sales teams to drive a centralized offering development process with services offering development team. Drive alignment with Segments, other Offer Towers and sales on Digital Workplace Automation and Life Cycle Service portfolio vision and strategy Ensure Digital Workplace Automation and Life Cycle Services portfolio is cohesive with the corporate strategy and other offerings being created outside of the portfolio Be the internal & external lead SME for Digital Workplace Automation and Life Cycle Managed Services Portfolio Position Requirements: Were looking to add talented individuals who are self-motivated and desire boundless opportunities, to join us. Come share in the discoveries that are forged from our shared achievements at Lenovo as we drive the next generation in technology. Minimum Requirements: 5+ years of Managed Services product experience – sales/marketing and channel experience a plus 3+ years of portfolio management, product development or similar experience Strong knowledge of Managed Services business & market landscape Strong executive presence & leadership skills High level of communication & presentation skills Strong business & financial acumen Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment A collaborative approach to meeting business objectives and ability to influence at all levels of matrixed organizations Experience working with global teams and conducting business internationally You will report to SSG (Solutions & Services Group) organization structure. SSG has been focusing on the expanding IT service market, especially the digital workplace services opportunity, the growing demand for aaS (as-a-Service) model, and customers’ stronger preference for sustainability services. Meanwhile, SSG continued to invest in software tools, platforms, and repeatable vertical solutions with our own IP, and focus on vertical solutions in manufacturing, retail, healthcare, education, and Smart City. We are expanding TruScale as-a-Service to Digital Workplace solutions, developing our Hybrid Cloud solutions, and exploring Metaverse solutions. What Lenovo can offer you: Opportunities for career development & growth Access to various training Performance-based rewards Flexible working environment (combination of working from home/office) We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any federal, state, or local protected class. Being an AI company, data is one of our core values and we take great pride in following industry best practices for the modern, resilient and cloud-agnostic data stack. If you join our team you will get first-hand, full-immersion experience in dealing with the real-world issues of ingesting, transforming and serving big data. What we are looking for: We are looking for an experienced Legal Counsel with crypto, NFT and blockchain experience to our team. This person will be responsible for supporting us in all aspects of the token launching, new product launch, day-to-day legal queries and concerns. Your responsibilities will include: Advise legal issues surrounding token launches such as regulatory issues around picking up a jurisdiction, setting up the entity Advice on structuring the financial product - Regulated vs unregulated, utility ve security token Advice on contracts and agreements Work the team in reg/corporate filing and whitepapers Answer to general questions and concerns directed to Legal Counsel We are looking for people who have an understanding of the fast-changing crypto landscape. Experience in the following areas will be beneficial: Regulations around stablecoins (fiat/crypto backed or seigniorage coins) Understanding of DeFi and utility/security tokens Understanding of Exchange traded products (ETFs/ETPs) Any work experience with a UK/US regulator would be favorably considered. What you will get in return: Being part of one of the greatest DeFi, AI and blockchain teams in the world that aims to create beneficial Artificial General Intelligence for the good of humanity The opportunity to help build a groundbreaking AI-driven metaverse together with other world-leading experts. A lot of freedom and responsibility in organizing your work hours and location Opportunities to advance your career in many potential directions Salary and benefits are in line with your experience and location you are based.
